Everything about refunds 

Hey bunqers 

Was the item that you purchased not delivered, or was the service that you paid for not as described? Is the merchant unreachable or unwilling to help?

### What is a refund?

A refund (a.k.a chargeback) is a form of purchase protection by Mastercard. In the case of disagreement between you and the merchant, we can formally dispute the payment via the Mastercard collaboration network. Don't know how to get one? No worries, we’re here to help you 

Don’t forget to check our tips on [how to recognize fraud and stay safe](https://together.bunq.com/d/40318)

Do you not recognize the payment and suspect that your account has been fraudulently charged? You can learn more what to do [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/23367)

## How can I get a refund?

**To request a refund via the app, follow the steps explained [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/47826)** 

Unless the transaction is unrecognized, always make sure to contact the merchant regarding the transaction that needs a refund. In most cases the refund is done by the merchant and the whole process takes a couple of business days. 

Most merchants would happily assist you in correcting the charge and returning your money. That's why before using Mastercard purchase protection, we ask you to settle your dispute with the merchant.

 **Tip ** We always advise you to contact them by chat or e-mail so you have the transcript of your communication with them. Make sure you share your order reference details with the merchant. This ensures their support team understands your situation correctly, and can provide you with the right solutions.

## What happens next?

Once the relevant waiting period has passed you have provided us with necessary documentation, and the request meets Mastercard’s refund conditions, we can proceed with performing the refund ourselves.

It's important to note that the merchant's still able to dispute the refund within 45 days, please check our [pricing sheet](https://www.bunq.com/en/pricing-sheet), for more information about incidental costs. Our team will remain at your disposal to help you throughout the whole process.

 **Tip ** Speed up the process by uploading your order confirmation, communication with the merchant, and any other relevant documents when you request a chargeback in the app. 

**Important:** The process of reviewing your claim and processing with the refund may take from 1 to 12 business weeks. Depending on the individual case, different steps may be taken within the process. We kindly ask for your patience, and we'll update you along the way!

## Types of refunds

bunq deals with 2 types of card refunds: pre-authorization releases, and chargebacks. Still not sure what can be refunded? Learn more [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/49940).

### Pre-authorizations 

Pre-authorized payments aren’t finalized ones but a reservation of your funds for the merchant as a way to ensure you have sufficient amounts in your account. 

You can request a refund on these types of payments. The estimated time for the refund’s processing is from 8 to 31 days depending on the merchant’s industry. A proof of release sent to your Support Center will ensure faster processing 

Further information about them can be found [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/48140).

If the payment was already settled with the merchant and the refund request gets denied, proceed by requesting another refund, which will be considered as a chargeback.

### Chargebacks 

Chargeback is a form of purchase protection from Mastercard. In case of disagreement between you and a merchant, we can formally dispute the payment via the Mastercard collaboration network. 

Further information on this matter can be found [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/48165)

## Can I get a refund on a Direct Debit?

You can easily request a refund for a Direct debit by following the steps explained [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/47826) 

The refund is only available within 56 days of the direct debit is accepted. However, it's not available to Business to Business direct debits. When you request the refund, we'll inform the merchant you want your funds back so they can help you further. 

## Can I get a refund on my subscription plan?

The answer is yes, if you contact us within 24 hours from the billing moment. To request this refund, you can contact our [Support Team via the in-app chat](https://together.bunq.com/d/32181) and inform us which plan you want to use. 

Before requesting your new plan, make sure your account fits into the plan’s applicable benefits (number of Bank Accounts and cards active).

## FAQ
**Q: I opened an XML file and sent the payment. But only now I realize there was a mistake! Can you book the payment back? Will you cover the damages due to this?**
A: It is never possible to book back an SCT payment, as the inter-bank system does not allow the refund option. The best way to get your money back is getting in touch with the recipient to ask if they can send the money back. bunq is not liable for mistakes in the XML file processing: we always show you a preview of the payment(s), so that you can double-check that all details are correct. 

**Q: I've some XML files on my computer that I'd need to process. Is there a way to send them to my bunq app directly?**
A: At the moment, you'll need to open the XML file on your phone. Only when you open the XML file from your phone, you'll have the option to open it with the bunq app for the processing of the payments. To do this, you can, for example, send the file to your email address and open the email from your phone. Of course, we welcome your feedback on Together for future improvements!

**Q: How do I import an XML file on iOS?**
A: You can airdrop the XML file to your iPhone, download it from your accounting app or have in your email app. Then simply tap on it and select the option to open it with bunq. The bunq app will open the file and process the batch.

**Q: How do I import an XML file on Android?**
A: You can save the file on the storage of your phone, or download it. Then choose to open it with the bunq app. However, it's good to know there's an exception with Gmail that doesn't allow opening of XML files.

**Q: Is it possible to schedule the XML batch to be paid in the future, instead of immediately when uploading?**
A: Unfortunately, the processing date is not considered and the payments are directly processed.

## Aber was genau ist eine deutsche IBAN? 

Wie ihr alle wisst, ist bunq eine europäische Bank mit Sitz in den Niederlanden, was bedeutet, dass deine IBANs aus den Niederlanden kommen. Das erkennt man am NL am Anfang der IBAN. Wenn du ein neuer bunqer bist, werden alle deine IBANs ab der Eröffnung deines neuen bunq-Kontos eine deutsche IBAN haben - vorausgesetzt, du hast einen deutschen Wohnsitz. 

Dies ist ein großer Schritt nach vorn für uns alle! Wir werden auch in Zukunft daran arbeit, unser Angebot auf verschiedene Märkte zuzuschneiden, um es euch zu ermöglichen, überall frei zu sein, egal wo ihr wohnt oder wohin es euch verschlägt. 

Bitte beachte, dass Deutsche IBANs an einen Wohnort in Deutschland geknüpft sind.

Du kannst deine brandneue deutsche IBAN erhalten, indem du diese einfachen Schritte befolgst:

Im Moment ist dieses Feature nur für die Privatkonten unserer neuen deutschen bunqer verfügbar. Durchlaufe einfach den Prozess. Du erhältst auch dann deine deutsche IBAN bekommen, wenn du vorher bereits niederländische IBANs hattest. Anti-Fraud Guide: I've been scammed. What can I do?



Hey bunqers 

Discovering you’re a victim of fraud is an unpleasant experience. It’s perfectly natural to be angry, but it’s really important to remember that you have the power to help yourself and also help others to avoid becoming a victim. We prepared this topic to help you understand what you should do if you discover that you’re a victim of fraud.

**Need to report a fraud incident to bunq? Fill out [this form](https://www.bunq.com/report) to report your incident and help us to fight fraud!**

### I was scammed, what do I do now?

- **Report it to your bank’s customer support**
  - Give all available details of the scam and the fraudulent transaction. The details that you should share are all key information of the fraudulent payment (sender's name, sender's IBAN, recipient's name, recipient's IBAN, amount, date, etc). If the payment was made via a credit/debit card, please include the first 6 and last 4 digits of the card used. Also include any relevant screenshots or export of the payment confirmation as shown on your bank statements.

- **Report it to the police**
  - Also, report the scam to the police to make them aware too. In the Netherlands for example you can report these types of incidents online [here](https://www.politie.nl/aangifte-of-melding-doen). Once a police report has been made forward it both to your bank and the scammer's bank in order to further assist in the case.

## Will I be able to get a refund?

Refunds for fraud through your bank or a court decision is possible, but it’s very important that you [follow the correct procedures](https://www.politie.nl/onderwerpen/internetoplichting.html). As stated above, the most important thing to do is report the incident to your bank and the police. Both of these groups can help you through different processes:

- **The police**
  - The police can start a criminal investigation thanks to the report. The criminal investigation can lead to a trial for the scammer, and a judge can then order the scammer to pay back the victims.

- **Your bank**
  - Your own bank will be able to contact the bank of the scammer via a special channel, to check if it's possible to get the money back.

Reporting the scam is important not only for your own case but allowing banks and the police to better identify scams in the future to help others.

## What to do if you don’t trust a bunq.me link?
If you receive a bunq.me payment link and you suspect it's fraud, please use the report button to report the page to our compliance team. The team will immediately take action against the account.

Metal Credit Card: How does it work and how can I order?

Hey bunqers 

Starting from January 15, 2024, we'll no longer be providing our Metal Credit Card as part of our offerings. However, if you’re currently a Metal Credit Card holder and require a replacement, please be aware that the availability of replacement cards is limited.

 **Important Note**: 
 -  Please keep in mind that you can only order a bunq Metal Credit Card replacement if **your account is fully active and has a positive balance**. 
- The free replacement doesn't apply to Metal Cards. **Replacing Metal Credit Cards comes with a €89.99 fee**. Check our [pricing sheet](https://www.bunq.com/pricing-sheet) for more information. 
- The Metal Credit Card is a **non-refundable** one. 

## Will the shipment of my Metal Credit Card replacement be tracked?
 
Yes! Your card will be sent via tracked delivery in a super green way and will be delivered **in 2 weeks**.  We’ve partnered with DHL to use the new Go Green service. 

## Is the Metal Credit Card a real credit card?
 
The Metal Credit Card is a true credit card. You can use it for all your spending needs, without the risk of falling into debt. 

Merchants will, therefore, recognize the Metal Credit Card as a credit card, so you can continue to get the best acceptance worldwide and online. Easily add money directly to the card and you’re all set to spend. For more info, [check this page](https://together.bunq.com/d/23426-is-the-bunq-metal-card-a-credit-card).

## Do I plant trees when I send outgoing payments (SEPA, iDEAL, SOFORT)?
 
If you're an Easy Green user, we'll be planting trees for every €100 you spend with your Metal Card.  That doesn't include standard outgoing payments made in the app.

## Are there any benefits for getting a Metal Credit Card?
 
For Easy Green users, payments made with your Metal Credit Card are insured with the Purchase Protection system powered by Companjon 

You can find more information [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/24344).

## Can I still use the card if I change my plan

Keep in mind that if you decide to downgrade your plan to the Easy Money or the Easy Bank plan, you can still use the card you're using after you've ordered it.

## When does my Metal Credit Card expire?

Metal Credit Card expire **4 years** after the date of order (example: If you've **ordered** the card on September 21, 2023, the card will be active until September 21, 2027)

**Important Note:** All Metal Credit Card ordered before September 21, 2023 expire **6 years** after the date of order.

After expiry you'll be able to replace it **only if there's availability.** If the Metal Credit Cards are already sold out, you'll be able to order a new Credit Card by following the steps mentioned [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/22397).

## My card was swallowed by an ATM, what should I do?

When a Metal Credit Card is **swallowed by an ATM,** the ATM owner eventually sends it back to us. But in those cases, we've to destroy and dispose of the card, which means that **you've to replace the card on your own costs**.

## An unrecognized transaction was done with my Metal Credit Card, what should I do? 

No need to worry - simply follow the steps explained [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/23367). 

Due to security reasons, you'll be asked to permanently block the card from which the payment was made. In such a case, if you want to order a replacement for your Metal Credit Card, you'll need to pay the replacement price of €89.99.

You can also contact and follow-up with the merchant from which the unrecognized payment was made to discuss further details on the payment and possible refund.

Who can open a bunq business account in France 

Hey bunqers  

Your safety and well-being are our priority. We have an acceptance policy in place to abide by legal regulations and follow some of our own risk standards as a company.

After you complete the sign-up process in 5 minutes, we'll quickly review your application. We assess each application individually to make sure every company is held to the same standard and fulfils all requirements.

bunq [Easy Savings](https://together.bunq.com/d/48095), [Easy Bank](https://together.bunq.com/d/44002-easy-bank), [Easy Money](https://www.bunq.com/business) and [Easy Green](https://together.bunq.com/d/26307) let you save time, so you can focus on what's truly important: your business. Wondering if you can sign up for a business account? Check out the requirements for opening an account below:

### Who can open an account?

Here are the basic conditions you need to meet in order to open a bunq business account:

- You need to have a verified personal account with bunq.
- You as a director cannot be a minor.
- You need to run a legitimate business in France .
- You need to be permanently residing in France 
- Your business should operate under one of the legal forms currently accepted by bunq. Find the full list [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/9256).
- Your company’s corporate structure and activities should comply with bunq’s requirements. More details on this below.
- Your business entity cannot have more than one account with bunq.
- If your company has multiple trade names (under the same registration on the Chamber of Commerce) - you can effortlessly open a sub-account with the different names like we explain [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/24341-trade-names-for-your-business-bank-accounts).
- If the various layers of your company are registered as separate legal entities with the Chamber of Commerce (Chambre du Commerce), each one would need its own Business accounts.

Once we confirm the above-mentioned conditions are met, we need to determine whether your business entity is registered with the local Chamber of Commerce or, in specific situations, you are operating on a freelance basis. Depending on that, we require different documents in order to approve your account.

Please also keep in mind that as a bank, we are legally required to store all of our user’s personal information in a secure and protected way. If there is more than one director,  we create personal accounts for each director of the business accounts. It allows us to keep your information and your company’s information safe while complying with regulations. Check out [this topic](https://together.bunq.com/d/38241) for more information.

---

## Legal forms and documents

In order to open a business account with bunq, you need to provide a legal form together with a few documents. We accept the following legal forms.

- Entreprise Individuelle
- Société à responsabilité limitée (SARL)
- Entreprise unipersonnelle à responsabilité limitée (EURL)
- Société par Actions Simplifiée (SAS)
- Société par Actions Simplifiée Unipersonnelle (SASU)

For each legal form, we require the following documents.

- Entreprise Individuelle
 - EXTRAIT Kbis (infogreffe excerpt)
- Société à responsabilité limitée (SARL)
 - EXTRAIT Kbis (infogreffe excerpt)
-  Articles of Association
 - Joint Authorisation if your company has more than one director
 - IDs of all directors and Ultimate Beneficial Owners (UBOs)
- Entreprise unipersonnelle à responsabilité limitée (EURL)
 - EXTRAIT Kbis (infogreffe excerpt)
 - Articles of Association
 - UBO form if the EURL's shares are not held by a natural person
 - Joint Authorisation if your company has more than one director
 - IDs of all directors and UBOs
- Société par Actions Simplifiée (SAS) or Société par Actions Simplifiée Unipersonnelle (SASU)
 - A copy of the KBIS that’s less than 3 months old;
 - A copy of the company's statutes;
 - An identity document of the director
 - An identity document for each beneficial owner. A beneficial owner is a natural person directly or indirectly holding more than 25% of the company's capital or voting rights;
 - Joint authorization consent form (if more than one director is present)
 - [If needed] A proof of address of the SAS/SASU less than three months old (hosting certificate attached to a proof of domicile that’s less than 3 months old, in case the domicile of the company is with its president);



Please find more information on legal documents [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/24017).

---

## Company activities

In accordance with our acceptance policy, we do not support all types of businesses and activities. You can find more information on activities and check whether your business activity meets the requirements [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/9256-why-do-i-have-to-provide-business-activity-information).

## Ich wurde betrogen. Was kann ich tun? 

Zu erfahren, dass du ein Betrugsopfer bist, ist eine unangenehme Erfahrung. Es ist vollkommen normal, dass du sauer wirst. Allerdings ist es sehr wichtig, dich daran zu erinnern, dass du die Macht hast, dir selbst zu helfen und auch dazu beizutragen, zukünftige Fälle zu vermeiden. Diesen Artikel haben wir veröffentlicht, damit du verstehen kannst, was gemacht werden sollte, wenn du ein Betrugsopfer bist.
 
## Ich wurde betrogen, was sollte ich jetzt tun?

**- Melde es dem Kundendienst deiner Bank**

Gib alle vorhandenen Details des Betrugs und der arglistigen Transaktion an. Die Daten, die du mitteilen solltest, sind die Daten der betrügerischen Transaktion (Name des Senders, IBAN des Senders, Name des Empfängers, IBAN des Empfängers, Betrag, Datum, etc). Füge bitte alle relevanten Screenshots oder einen Export der Zahlungsbestätigung hinzu, wie es auf dem Auszug zu sehen ist.
**- Melde es der Polizei**

Melde den Betrug bei der Polizei, damit auch sie darüber Bescheid weiß. Z.B. in den Niederlanden könntest du diese Art von Vorfällen hier online melden.

## Werde ich eine Rückerstattung bekommen können?

Rückerstattungen durch deine Bank oder eine gerichtliche Entscheidung aufgrund von Betrug sind möglich, allerdings ist es wichtig dem richtigem Vorgehen zu folgen. So wie oben beschrieben, ist das Wichtigste wäre den Vorfall bei deiner Bank und bei der Polizei zu melden. Beide Gruppen können dir durch unterschiedliche Prozesse helfen. 

**- Die Polizei**

Die Polizei kann eine strafrechtliche Ermittlung dank des Reports einleiten. Die strafrechtliche Ermittlung könnte zu einem Prozess für den Betrüger führen und ein Richter kann dann anordnen, dass der Betrüger den Opfern alles erstatten muss.

**- Deine Bank**

Deine eigene Bank hat die Möglichkeit, Kontakt mit der Bank des Betrügers über einen Sonderkanal aufzunehmen und zu überprüfen, ob die Option besteht, das Geld zurückzubekommen.
Den Betrug zu melden ist nicht nur für deinen eigenen Fall wichtig, sondern würde es auch den Banken und der Polizei ermöglichen, in der Zukunft Betrugsfälle besser zu identifizieren, um anderen zu helfen.

## Musst du einen Betrugsfall bei bunq melden?

Fülle diese Formular aus, um den Fall zu melden und hilf uns den Betrug zu bekämpfen.

Was ist zu tun, wenn du einen bunq.me Link nicht vertraust?
Falls du einen bunq.me Link bekommen hast und Betrug vermutest tippe bitte auf den Report Button, um den Fall bei unserem Compliance Team zu melden. Das Team Ergreift in diesem Fall sofort Maßnahmen

Why do I need to fill in a Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN)?

In agreement with other countries to prevent fraud and tax evasion, the Dutch government shares citizens' tax information based on the Common Reporting Standard (CRS).

### Why should I provide my TIN?

As a bank, we are legally required to ask new users where they are a tax resident and to provide us with their corresponding tax numbers (check [here](https://www.rijksoverheid.nl/onderwerpen/privacy-en-persoonsgegevens/vraag-en-antwoord/welke-organisaties-mogen-mijn-burgerservicenummer-bsn-gebruiken) for more info). This applies to bunqers from all countries and you have **90 days** after signup to provide this. If you fail to meet the deadline, your account will be temporarily limited until we receive the required document showing your Tax Identification Number from you. Are you experiencing difficulties submitting your TIN via the app? You can also submit it by reaching out to our [Support Team via the in-app chat](https://together.bunq.com/d/32181).

Your tax residency doesn't always depend on the country where you live. You can be tax liable in more than one country. For instance, if you are a US person, you will have to report income tax to the IRS even when living abroad. 

* **Important note**: If you were born in the US, keep in mind that our relevant team will ask you to also provide your SSN number. This is due to the same legal reasons we ask you for your TIN 

Why can't I close my Bank Account?

Hey bunqers  

Are you getting an error message when you try to close your account? That's because not all the conditions for closure are satisfied. If you don't meet one of the conditions, you can easily correct it by following the steps below. Just make sure to check the relevant section for the error message that you're getting from the bunq app 


## The balance on your account isn't exactly €0,00

- If you have excessive funds on the account, you can just tap on the [Pay button](https://www.bunq.com/link/pay) in the Accounts menu, and [transfer the remaining funds](https://together.bunq.com/d/115-how-to-make-a-payment) to a different bank account

- If you have a negative balance, make sure to [top-up](https://together.bunq.com/d/2933-deposit-to-bunq-accounts) your account to bring the balance back to 0

## There are payments scheduled from your account

 - If you have scheduled payments, you can remove them when you go to your [Events](https://www.bunq.com/link/events) menu > Scheduled Payments icon

 - When you tap on a Scheduled Payment, you'll see an option to cancel it

## There are pending Requests for the account

 - If you have pending requests, you can find them through the filter feature: go to your [Events](https://www.bunq.com/link/events) menu > Search bar > Filter icon > select 'Open Requests to others' > Apply

 - You can then see the option to cancel or close the pending requests when you tap on them

## There are pending bunq.to payments for the account

 - If you have pending bunq.to payments, you can find them through the filter feature: go to your [Events](https://www.bunq.com/link/events) menu > Search bar > Filter icon > choose to filter for 'Paid' amounts and for transactions in the last week > Apply

 - What you're looking for is a payment to a phone number or email address - just tap on it to see the option cancel the payment
 
## There are no pending iDEAL deposits for the account

 - Pending iDEAL deposits will expire when they're inactive for too long - just try again later to close your bank account

## The account is linked to one or more of your cards

 - Go to your [Cards](https://www.bunq.com/link/cards) menu, and make sure that all cards are [connected to a different account](https://together.bunq.com/d/233-switch-cards-bank-account) from the one you want to close

 - If one of your cards was ordered from the bank account that you're closing, you'll have to permanently block the card: go to [Cards](https://www.bunq.com/link/cards) > tap on the card you need to block > Deactivate or Block > Block Card (note: the card can't be temporarily deactivated but needs to be permanently blocked)

## There are active Connects for the account

 - If you have active Connects, go to your [Accounts menu](https://www.bunq.com/link/accounts) > tap on the bank account > Settings > Connects > tap on Active Connects > Stop Connect

## The account is selected as your billing account

 - If you're trying to close your [Billing Account](https://together.bunq.com/d/2388-billing-account), you'll have to select a different account for billing first: Tap on Profile  > Settings > My Plans > Billing Account > choose a different bank account for billing

 - Note that you can only close your Billing Account if this is the only active bunq bank account that you have

## What is the difference between a Joint account and Shared Access?

A [Joint account](https://together.bunq.com/d/196-how-do-i-create-a-joint-en-of-bank-account) is an account where there's more than one owner. All owners will be legal owners, and therefore the account is in all their names. A Shared Access account is a Bank Account where you give access to your friend/family member. You'll stay the legal owner of the account.

## How can I cancel Shared Access?

1. Go to Home tab
2. Select your Bank Account
3. Tap on ⚙️ Settings
4. Tap on “Granted Access To”
5. Select and cancel the Shared Access

## Good to know

- Available for Easy Bank, Easy Money and Easy Green.
- Easy Savings users can receive and accept Shared Access requests from other users. However, they can't grant Shared Access to their own Bank Accounts.
- Invitees are able to link their personal card to the Shared Access
- All funds on the Shared Access Bank Account count for the owner for Tax Authorities.
- If a card is linked to the Shared Access Bank Account the transaction fees + card withdrawal fees will be for the owner of the Shared Access Bank Account, not the card owner.
- You can't share access for two Business Accounts. You can only share from a Personal to a Personal Account or from a Business Account to a Personal one.
- If the invitee is unverified, this can cause an issue in the app, so it's best to advise the invitee to [verify](https://together.bunq.com/d/24112) first.
- It's not possible for the user with Shared Access to make iDeal payments as it wouldn't be possible to wait for the director to approve first.
- Invitees aren't able to schedule payments.
- Keep in mind that all Shared Access accounts count towards your Bank Account limit according to [your plan](https://together.bunq.com/d/3892).

## Who can open an account?

Here are the basic conditions you need to meet in order to open a bunq business account:

- You need to have a verified personal account with bunq.
- You as a director cannot be a minor.
- You need to run a legitimate business in Austria.
- You need to be permanently residing in the Austria.
- Your business should operate under one of the legal forms currently accepted by bunq. Find the full list [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/9256).
- Your company’s corporate structure and activities should comply with bunq’s requirements. More details on this below.
- Your business entity cannot have more than one account with bunq.

- If the various layers of your company are registered as separate legal entities with the Chamber of Commerce (Wirtschaftskammer Österreich), each one would need its own Business accounts.

Once we confirm the above-mentioned conditions are met, we need to determine whether your business entity is registered with the local Chamber of Commerce or, in specific situations, you are operating on a freelance basis. Depending on that, we require different documents in order to approve your account.

Please also keep in mind that as a bank, we are legally required to store all of our user’s personal information in a secure and protected way. If there is more than one director,  we create personal accounts for each director of the business accounts. It allows us to keep your information and your company’s information safe while complying with regulations. Check out [this topic](https://together.bunq.com/d/38241) for more information.

- A bunq.to payment expires after 5 days of no response. The money will then return to the sender's bank account.

- The difference between shared requests and all other types of requests is that a shared request isn't directed to a specific person. A shared request only contains the amount of money that's requested. After confirming the request you'll get an URL that can be shared via multiple platforms (WhatsApp, Messenger, email) to an unlimited number of people. 

- A shared request closes after 30 days and can be paid by an unlimited amount of people through iDEAL or SOFORT

How do I solve a failed PIN payment?

Hey bunqers  

In this topic we'll list some of the reasons behind a failed PIN payment and how to resolve it.

### Wrong PIN 

If the payment is declined because a wrong PIN has been entered, the screen of the terminal and your bunq app will tell you so. In this situation, you should [change your card’s PIN](https://go.bunq.com/link/set-pin) which will instantly be updated in our system. However, if you try to pay again right after, a few terminals might not be able to read the updated PIN code on the chip of your card and give you the same error message. In this situation, you should make an ATM transaction to ensure that the PIN code of your card gets updated on the chip of your card as well. 

*Note: If you entered the wrong PIN code 3 times, you'll need to [reset it](https://together.bunq.com/d/60-change-a-cards-pin) in the bunq app to complete the payment.*

### Country isn't allowed 

When you're travelling, it might happen that your card payments get declined because the country you're visiting isn't enabled yet. You can easily change that by adding it to your list of enabled countries or by enabling card payments worldwide. You can see how to do this [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/2815).

### Card isn't active 

In order to be approved, card payments must be done with an active card. This means that if you've just ordered your card and haven't activated it yet or if your card is temporarily frozen, the payment won't go through. In such cases, you should first [activate your card](https://together.bunq.com/d/3985) before you try to pay again. 

### Exceeded daily limit 

To protect your money, we've set a default daily limit of [€1,000 per day that can be adjusted up to €50,000 per day](https://together.bunq.com/d/6635). You can always change it by following the steps presented on this [link](https://together.bunq.com/d/4757).

### Cash withdrawals 
If you can’t withdraw money at an ATM, you should first check that you haven’t reached your [daily limit of €500](https://together.bunq.com/d/4757-changing-my-daily-card-limit) set for all bunq cards and keep in mind that the ATM might've its own limit too. Please try withdrawing a lower sum can help you withdraw correctly.

### Insufficient balance 
When you're trying to pay an amount bigger than the balance on your account, the payment won't go through to make sure you don’t fall into debt. 

In this situation, you should [top up your account](https://together.bunq.com/d/2933) or [link your card to another bunq Bank Account](https://together.bunq.com/d/233) to complete the payment.

### Will there be an error shown on the POS terminal? ❌

When you pay on a POS terminal, errors with different messages can appear on it if the payment fails. Some of them will state the exact reason why this card payment has failed and others will show a different type of error. This might be caused by the card not being accepted by the terminal so we suggest trying another card of yours or try paying with your Google or Apple Pay.

Wise Payments FAQ

Hey bunqers  

Wondering how to convert payments in other currency to Euros, to you receive it in your bunq account? Or how to convert your payments from Euro to another currency? Wise is here to help us convert outgoing or incoming payments 

Got questions about your [Wise transfer](https://together.bunq.com/d/5149-what-is-wise-and-how-do-i-send-international-payments-with-it/2)? Check out the most frequently asked questions below!


## Why hasn't the money I sent arrived?

It can take a few days for the money to arrive on the recipient's account (usually up to 2 business days). If the money hasn’t arrived by the estimated delivery time, Wise can provide you with a PDF transfer receipt that can be used to locate the funds at the beneficiary bank.

__________

## How long will my transfer take?

Wise always moves your money as quickly as possible. When you set up a transfer you will see an estimate of how long it will take. This depends on two things:

1. The country you’re sending money to.

Every currency and country is different. Converting your money can take a maximum of two working days, but this happens very rarely. The speed of your transfer depends on how quickly your recipient’s bank can process your money.

2. The time you made the transfer.

Wise handles your money during normal banking hours. Times also may vary if the country you’re sending money to has a national holiday.
__________

## Can I change my recipient’s bank details?

The recipient's details can only be changed up until the point that Wise has paid out your money. After your money has been paid out, the recipient's details can no longer be changed.

You can get in touch with Wise at bunq@wise.com or contact them via chat or phone [here](https://wise.com/contact). Remember to quote your Wise ID (shown on your payment in the bunq app) when you contact Wise.
__________

## Can I reverse or cancel a completed transfer?

All transfers completed by Wise are final and Wise cannot reverse or recall payments.

Wise does not have the ability to be involved in disputes between senders and recipients, so we strongly recommend you know and trust the person or business you are sending money to.

Once funds have been sent to a recipient's account and are marked as complete, transfers are final.

---

## Can I cancel my transfer? 

You can’t personally cancel a transfer, but if you get in touch with Wise support they can cancel the transfer for you. Keep in mind the transfer can only be canceled up until the point Wise pays out your funds. Once the money has been sent to the recipient, it’s not possible to cancel the transfer anymore.

---

## What are the fees?

The fees depend on the currency and the amount you’re sending. Before making the payment, the fees will be shown on your screen. The payment fees are paid directly to Wise.

---

## I want to cancel the transfer I did, how do I do that?

If you want to cancel the payment because the other account isn’t reachable, you’ll need to settle this with the receiver or their bank.

---

## I got an error message "The item you requested could not be found", what should I do?

You get this error when making a Wise payment from a connected account you're not the owner of. Make sure to make the transfer from a personal sub-account which you own 

---

## I got an error message ““Error: the smallest amount a recipient can get is 10 RPL/any other currency.”, what should I do?

When you start to make a payment using Wise and you stop typing after 0.5 seconds, the amount already entered will be registered in the backend and you may receive the error regarding “the smallest amount a recipient can get is 10 RPL/any other currency”.

This isn’t a bug but simply how the system is set up. Therefore, you can continue entering the amount you want to transfer by dismissing the error.

---

## I’m stuck in a loop where I have to log in both the bunq app and Wise over again, what should I do?

In this case,  you can check auto logout. If it’s set to 0 seconds, the app first connects with Wise and
then redirects to the bunq app but forgets about the Wise connection. Therefore it starts from
scratch, which causes the loop. You can simply change your auto logout settings and set them to a different (higher) metric. 

---

## Can I make Wise transfers as a Connect?

It's not possible to make a Wise payment from a Connect account. This has to do with the limitations on the side of Wise. Your bunq account is linked to your personal Wise account and while on our side, we do offer a Connect feature, this isn’t possible on the side of Wise.

__________

## Need further help? 

If you are looking for more information about the currency you're sending to, check [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/5185)!

If you need to get in touch with bunq support about your transfer, you can contact [Private Matters](https://www.bunq.com/link/support).

If you need to get in touch with Wise, you can email them at bunq@wise.com or contact them via chat or phone [here](https://wise.com/contact). Remember to always quote your Wise ID (shown on your payment in the bunq app) whenever you contact Wise.

*Keep in mind that the above only applies to outgoing transfers. Incoming transfers must be received in euros, so feel free to  use Wise to help you with the currency conversion by checking out [their site]( https://transferwise.com/nl/) .*

How does AutoVAT work?



Hey bunqers 

Our commitment to business owners is to continue to build a business banking platform that saves your most precious asset: your time.  

Now you can automatically have your VAT ready when the tax man comes around - for both **incoming and outgoing payments!** 

### How does incoming AutoVAT work?

You finish painting the house for your client. 

Your client pays you for your work and you receive €121,00, including VAT. By enabling incoming VAT, €21,00 will automatically be set aside in your dedicated AutoVAT Bank Account. No extra effort from your side required!

### How does outgoing AutoVAT work?

Imagine you own a house-painting business. You need to buy paint to complete a project for your client. 

If you buy €42 worth of paint (which has a VAT of 9% in the Netherlands) to renovate the house, €3,78 will then be taken out of your AutoVAT Bank Account and added to your main Bank Account automatically.

## How do both VATs work together?

Incoming and outgoing VAT will now both be taken into account. In relation to the scenario above, you’ll now have a balance of **€17,22** (€21,00 - €3,78) in your dedicated AutoVAT Bank Account.

## How does the VAT Bank Account work?

Each time a payment is received, the VAT percentage of it is automatically set aside to the VAT Bank Account. This is referred to as incoming or received VAT, which is the VAT collected from customers.

When a payment is made to another business, the VAT part of that payment, is reclaimed from the dedicated VAT account. This is where things become magical; based on who you’re paying, we detect how much VAT is due for that payment and automatically reclaim it from your VAT account. This is known as outgoing or reclaimed VAT. 

At the end of the quarter, the amount due to the government is calculated as the difference between the incoming and outgoing VAT.

## Do I need to apply the Local VAT rate manually?

bunq has determined the VAT rates for different payment categories across various countries. Now, the appropriate local VAT rate is automatically applied to all your expenses. The VAT will be set on your payments based on the following:

- **Outgoing payments** - AutoVAT automatically adjusts VAT rates depending on the recipient of the payment and the VAT in the country you live in.

- **Incoming payments - when receiving funds, the VAT rate of your business is being applied

However, when you make payments to tax authorities, both incoming and outgoing payments will have a 0% VAT rate applied.

## How is VAT calculated in general?

VAT is always calculated on the *before-VAT-value*.  For this example:

Using  **21% as VAT percentage**.

- If you sell something for €100,- (without VAT), you'll have to pay €100,- x 21% = €21,- as VAT, meaning that the buyer pays you €121.
- Now €21,- (the VAT value) of €121 (the total paid value) does not equal 21% but 17,36%. This is correct.

To calculate the VAT you should: 

- Divide the value including VAT by 1 + fraction of VAT percentage. 
- In this example that is €121 / 1,21 = €100 
- Meaning €21,- is VAT as this is the difference.

Of course, depending on the VAT percentage, you should divide by a different value to get the amount without VAT:

- 9% it's 1,09  
- 21% it's 1,21

Now, if this does all sound complicated for you, look no further, because this is the feature you've been looking for. 

## How do I set it up in the bunq app?

Further information on how to set up your AutoVAT can be found [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/14717).

## How can I see my AutoVAT Overview?

In the Budgeting tab, you’ll be able to see your AutoVAT Overview for each quarter. Inside you’ll see clear sections for:

- Incoming VAT you’ve received
- Outgoing VAT you’ve paid
- Net VAT you need to pay for the quarter


## Good to know

* You can only reclaim the VAT on a payment once. The event will indicate whether the VAT was already reclaimed or not;
* When the balance in your Bank Account is insufficient for an outgoing AutoVAT, the VAT amount will not be moved to the Bank Account you're paying from.;
* The VAT amount will be moved from the AutoVAT account, towards the account you paid from. You **can't change** where to send the reclaimed AutoVAT. This is because the amount that comes in already includes the VAT, so we first have to calculate back to the amount without VAT.
- You can have only one active AutoVAT Bank Account a time
- If you make an inside transfer from your Bank Account to another Bank Account of yours, you won't trigger an AutoVAT calculation
- You can share the AutoVAT Bank Account with other people via [Connect](https://together.bunq.com/d/1982)
-  When you set up the feature, it'll automatically select all of your Bank Accounts. You can change this in the settings of the Bank Account you want to remove. 
-  Keep in mind that AutoVat doesn't work retrospectively - this means that your VAT will be calculated only for payments which were processed after the feature was activated. 

## FAQs

- **Who can use AutoVAT?**

Auto VAT is available for all bunq Easy Money and Easy Green business users .

- **My company receives payments where no VAT is applied on the bill. How can I arrange that with AutoVAT?**

The best way to arrange that is to use two different bank accounts for receiving the payments:

a) You can have one account where all the companies from your country pay you, and that can be enabled for saving AutoVAT.

b) Then you can have a bank account for companies outside your country to pay you, and that can be disabled for AutoVAT 

- **Do I get interest on my AutoVAT account?**

Yes, you get interest on your AutoVAT Savings account! Further information  on MassInterest can be found [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/8298).

 Wie man Betrug erkennt und sicher bleibt

## Wie man Betrug erkennt und sicher bleibt

Hallo, bunqers!  
Wie du weißt, nimmt bunq die Sicherheit deiner persönlichen Daten sehr ernst.  Wir haben bereits einige Tipps mitgeteilt, wie du dich und dein Geld hier schützen kannst. Allerdings dachten wir, dass es hilfreich sein könnte, weitere Tipps zu geben, damit du Betrug besser erkennen kannst.

## Phishing
Was ist Phishing? Phishing ist ein Versuch von Betrügern, deine persönlichen Daten wie Kennwörter oder Sicherheitsdaten abzurufen. Die Betrüger geben sich oft als vertrauenswürdige Organisation aus, indem sie gefälschte Webseiten verwenden, die wie legitime Webseiten aussehen. Das allgemeine Layout sowie der Link sind meistens fast genau gleich. Diese Webseiten sind sehr gut darin, dich zu überzeugen, dass sie eine echte Mail von (zum Beispiel) deiner Bank oder einem Online-Zahlungsabwickler senden, obwohl es sich tatsächlich um einen Betrug handelt.

Wenn du eine Mail oder andere Nachrichten erhältst, die den normalen Nachrichten von bunq ähneln, in denen du aufgefordert bist, einem Link zu folgen und dich anzumelden oder deine Anmeldecodes oder andere Sicherheitsinformationen weiterzugeben, befolge bitte diese Anweisungen nicht.

bunq würde niemals per Telefon (wir verwenden keine Telefonate als Kommunikationsmittel), per E-Mail, SMS, WhatsApp oder in irgendeiner Form von sozialen Medien nach deinen Anmeldedaten oder Sicherheitsfunktionen fragen.
Wenn du einer Website nicht vertraust oder dir nicht sicher bist, kannst du jederzeit Tools wie dieses verwenden, um dies zu überprüfen. 
Hier ein Tipp: Wenn es den Anschein macht, als sei die Webseite vor kurzem registriert, kann dies ein Hinweis darauf sein, dass die Website gefälscht ist. Weitere Informationen findest du im folgenden Thema.

## Old-school Phishing
Dies geschieht, wenn du deine PIN an einem Geldautomaten oder an einer Zahlstelle eingibst. Bitte stelle sicher, dass dich niemand beobachtet und du deine PIN immer verbirgst, währenddessen du sie eingibst. Bewahre anschließend deinen Passcode sicher.

## WhatsApp Betrug
WhatsApp-Betrug ist eine Form von Betrug, bei der jemand vorgibt, dich zu kennen und dich über eine WhatsApp-Nachricht darum bittet, ihm bei der Zahlung einer Rechnung zu helfen. In der Regel gelten folgende Eigenschaften:

Die "Person, die du kennst" hat eine neue Nummer und kontaktiert dich über WhatsApp.

Sie bittet dich darum, ihr zu helfen, indem du eine Rechnung für sie bezahlst.

Normalerweise ist die Person in Eile, die Rechnung muss schnell bezahlt werden;

Sie kann oder will nicht auf andere Weise als Whatsapp mit dir kommunizieren.

Wenn dich jemand auffordert, Geld zu überweisen oder eine vorhandene Rechnung zu bezahlen, wende dich bitte immer über andere Kommunikationsmittel außerhalb von Whatsapp an diese Person. Wenn du diese Person nicht erreichen kannst, überweise bitte kein Geld.
Wie könntest du helfen, diese Art von Betrügereien zu stoppen? Wenn der Betrüger einen Link bereitgestellt hat, solltest du die IBAN oder den Link der Polizei und der entsprechenden Bank melden.

## Gefälschte Zahlungsanfragen
Wenn du eine Zahlungsanforderung erhältst, überprüfe immer die Echtheit der Webseite, zu welcher der Link führt. Oft verwenden Betrüger gefälschte Internetseiten, die der normalen Zahlungsumgebung einer Bank sehr ähnlich sehen, allerdings ist die Website eine gefälschte. Die Informationen, die du in diese Zahlungsanforderung eingibst, sind für die Betrüger direkt sichtbar und können für den Zugriff auf dein Bankkonto verwendet werden.

Gebe niemals deine Daten ein, wenn du dem Zahlungslink oder der Person, die dir die Zahlungsanforderung sendet, nicht vertraust.

## Marketplace fraud
Es gibt viele Male, in denen man den gesuchten Artikel auf Gebrauchtwaren Webseiten findet. Das ist toll! Gebrauchtwaren sind billiger und die Wiederverwendung von Produkten trägt zu einer grüneren Welt bei. Leider liefert manchmal die Person das Produkt nicht, nachdem du schon bezahlt hast.

Woran erkennt man solche Betrüger? Zunächst möchten wir betonen, dass falls klingt als sei es zu gut um wahr zu sein, liegt es normalerweise daran, dass es nicht echt ist. Überprüfe immer den Marktwert des Produkts, das du kaufen möchtest. Wenn der Preis des angebotenen Produkts zu niedrig ist, kann dies ein Zeichen dafür sein, dass ein Betrüger am Werk ist.

## Werde kein Goldesel!
Wenn sich jemand an dich wendet und um Zugang zu deinem Bankkonto bittet oder Geld über dein Bankkonto überweisen möchte, folge dieser Aufforderung niemals, egal wie vielversprechend sie klingt!

Hier ein Beispiel: Jemand kontaktiert dich über soziale Medien oder Freunde und verspricht dir einen Geldbetrag. Die Person verspricht dir dieses Geld, wenn du Geld für sie überweist oder wenn sie dein Bankkonto für einige Tage nutzen kann. Sie wird dir sagen, dass es kein Risiko gibt und dass es wirklich leicht verdientest Geld ist.

Es ist sehr wahrscheinlich, dass dein Bankkonto für kriminelle Aktivitäten verwendet wird, für welche du (strafrechtlich) haftbar gemacht werden würdest. Dies kann zur Folge haben, dass du keine Bankkonten eröffnen, keine Hypothek aufnehmen oder keinen Kredit erhalten kannst und möglicherweise könnte ein Strafverfahren eingeleitet werden.

Bitte beachte hier, dass falls etwas klingt als sei es zu gut um wahr zu sein liegt dies normalerweise daran, dass es nicht wahr ist.
Weitere Informationen zu money mules, findest du auf dieser Webseite der niederländischen Polizei.

## Was ist zu tun, wenn du zu einem Betrugsopfer wirst oder Betrug vermutest?
Überprüfe dein Bankkonto regelmäßig und lese deine Bankpost nach Erhalt immer schnell. Wenn du Opfer von Betrügern geworden bist, wende dich sofort an deine Bank.

Wenn du einen Betrugsverdacht hast, informiere bitte deine Bank über den Verdacht.
Das Formular zur Meldung von mutmaßlichem Betrug oder Betrug bei bunq ist [hier](https://www.bunq.com/report) zu finden.

 Quando arriva il mio bonifico?





I bonifici tra banche nell'[area SEPA](http://www.sepaitalia.eu/welcome.asp?Page=2380&chardim=0&a=a&langid=1) arrivano al destinatario in **1 o 2 giorni lavorativi**. 
 
- Quando **invii un pagamento** dal tuo conto bunq, lo processiamo immediatamente e lo inviamo alla banca ricevente. Possono volerci un paio di giorni perché il pagamento compaia sul conto ricevente.
- Quando **aspetti un pagamento** da un'altra banca, non appena riceviamo il pagamento dalla banca mittente, lo elaboreremo immediatamente e lo aggiungeremo al tuo saldo.
 
Per maggiori dettagli sui tempi di arrivo dei bonifici, continua a leggere qui sotto. 
 
---
 
# Pagamenti in uscita

Quando mandi un bonifico dal tuo account bunq, vedrai un tempo di arrivo stimato per il pagamento. Puoi vederlo nella schermata di conferma del pagamento.
 
## SEPA
 
- I bonifici SEPA vengono elaborati dalla banca ricevente e arrivano al conto bancario del destinatario entro 1 o 2 giorni lavorativi.
- Se il pagamento non è arrivato dopo 2 giorni lavorativi, puoi esportare una [conferma della transazione](https://together.bunq.com/d/11710) e condividerla con la banca ricevente, per consentire alla banca di individuare il pagamento ed elaborarlo correttamente.
- I pagamenti tra banche che supportano i [bonifici SEPA istantanei](https://www.ebaclearing.eu/services/instant-payments/participants) arrivano immediatamente sul conto bancario del destinatario. 
 
## TransferWise

- Il tempo di arrivo esatto dipende dall'importo e della valuta del pagamento.
- Puoi vedere un tempo di arrivo previsto nella schermata di conferma del pagamento. [Il sito di TransferWise](https://transferwise.com/help/11/getting-started/2524078/how-long-does-a-transfer-take) fornisce maggiori informazioni.
 
---
 
# Pagamenti in entrata

Quando un’altra banca invia un bonifico al tuo conto bunq, bunq processa il pagamento non appena lo riceve dall'altra banca. Ti invieremo una notifica per fartelo sapere!

## SEPA

- Arrivo istantaneo per le banche che supportano i [bonifici SEPA istantanei](https://www.ebaclearing.eu/services/instant-payments/participants).
- I bonifici dalle altre banche possono richiedere fino a 2 giorni lavorativi.
- Se non ricevi il bonifico dopo 2 giorni lavorativi, puoi contattare la banca che ha inviato il pagamento per richiedere il codice identificativo del bonifico, per consentire a bunq di individuare il pagamento ed elaborarlo correttamente.

## bunq

- I pagamenti effettuati tra conti bunq sono sempre istantanei!

## SWIFT

- Richiedono fino a 1 settimana ad arrivare a causa dei tempi di elaborazione dell'altra banca.
- Consigliamo di utilizzare TransferWise per bonifici internazionali (poiché è più veloce ed economico).
- Possiamo elaborare solo bonifici ricevuti in Euro, i pagamenti in altre valute verranno restituiti al mittente.
- [Clicca qui](https://together.bunq.com/d/2010) per maggiori informazioni sui pagamenti da paesi al di fuori dell'area SEPA.

How is Cashback calculated and paid out?

Hey bunqers 

At bunq, we try to keep you informed on each and every detail. In this topic, we’ll explain how your Cashback is calculated, so you can better calculate your spend next time you hop on the bus, or go to restaurants and bars 

### How is Cashback calculated?

- Our system detects if the card used has been an eligible one
- If the Merchant Category Code and your card are eligible ones, Cashback feature gets triggered
- We take the whole sum you’ve paid and multiply it by the relevant percentage
- The calculated Cashback gets rounded if it’s necessary 

## How do I calculate my Cashback as an Easy Green user?

Easy Green users get 2% Cashback on public transportation and 1% at restaurants and bars. An example calculation will go as follows:

#### Public Transportation payment

 You’ve paid €9 for a daily ticket with your Credit Mastercard. We take the 2% of the €9 payment to calculate your earnings. The Cashback you’ll earn back in your billing account will be €9 x 2% = €0.20.

#### Restaurants and bars

 You’re at the restaurant and you decide to pay the €200 bill with your Credit Mastercard. We take the 1% of the €200 payment to calculate your earnings. The Cashback you’ll earn back in your billing account will be €200 x 1% = €2.

## How do I calculate my Cashback as an Easy Money user?

Easy Money users get 1% Cashback at restaurants and bars. An example calculation will go as follows:

#### Restaurants and bars

 You’re at the restaurant and you decide to pay the €200 bill with your Credit Mastercard. We take the 1% of the €200 payment to calculate your earnings. The Cashback you’ll earn back in your billing account will be €200 x 1% = €2.

## Where can I see if I've earned Cashback? 

If your payment is eligible for earning Cashback, you can see Cashback Earned by checking the payment details - just follow these easy steps: 

1. Go to Home
2. Tap on your card
3. Under Transactions find and click on your payment
4. See Cashback Earned

## When and where will I receive my Cashback?

Cashback will be paid out each week based on your Payday settings. The payout is being transferred to your billing sub-account. Further information can be found [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/57060).  ¿Cómo resuelvo un pago fallido con tarjeta?



Hay algunas cosas a las que debes prestar atención si estás intentando pagar con tu tarjeta bunq y no se acepta el pago. A continuación encontrarás una lista de lo que debes verificar si falla el pago de tu tarjeta.

---

## Si realizaste un pago con tarjeta para el cual tuviste que ingresar tu código PIN:

**PIN incorrecto**  
Si el pago se rechaza porque se ingresó un PIN incorrecto, la pantalla del terminal y tu aplicación bunq te lo indicarán. En esta situación, debes [cambiar el PIN de tu tarjeta](https://go.bunq.com/link/set-pin) que se actualizará instantáneamente en nuestro sistema. Sin embargo, si intentas volver a pagar inmediatamente después, es posible que algunas terminales no puedan leer el código PIN actualizado en el chip de tu tarjeta y te muestren el mismo mensaje de error. En esta situación, debes realizar una transacción en un cajero automático para asegurarte de que el código PIN de tu tarjeta también se actualice en el chip de tu tarjeta.

*Nota: Si ingresaste el código PIN incorrecto 3 veces, deberás [restablecerlo](https://www.together.bunq.com/d/3980) en la aplicación bunq para completar el pago.*

**El país no está permitido**  
Cuando viajas, puede suceder que se rechacen los pagos de tu tarjeta porque el país que estás visitando aún no está habilitado. Puedes cambiarlo fácilmente agregándolo a tu lista de países habilitados o bien, habilitando pagos con tarjeta en todo el mundo. Puedes ver cómo hacer esto [aquí](https://together.bunq.com/d/2815).

**La tarjeta no está activa**  
Para que se aprueben, los pagos con tarjeta deben hacerse con una tarjeta activa. Esto significa que si acabas de ordenar tu tarjeta y aún no la has activado o si tu tarjeta está temporalmente congelada, el pago no se realizará. En tales casos, primero debes [activar tu tarjeta](https://together.bunq.com/d/3985) antes de intentar pagar nuevamente.

**Límite diario excedido**   
Para proteger tu dinero, hemos establecido un límite diario predeterminado de [€ 1,000 por día que se puede ajustar hasta € 50,000 por día](https://together.bunq.com/d/6635). Siempre puedes cambiarlo siguiendo los pasos presentados en este [enlace](https://together.bunq.com/d/4757).


**Retiros de efectivo**  
Si no puedes retirar dinero en un cajero automático, primero debes asegurarte de no haber alcanzado tu [límite diario de € 500](https://together.bunq.com/d/4757-changing-my-daily -card-limit) establecido para todas las tarjetas bunq y ten en cuenta que el cajero automático también puede tener un límite propio. En este caso, intentar hacer un retiro por una suma menor puede ayudarte a conseguirlo.

**Saldo insuficiente**  
Cuando intentes pagar una cantidad mayor que el saldo de tu cuenta, el pago no se realizará para asegurarse de que no te endeudes. En esta situación, debes [recargar tu cuenta](https://together.bunq.com/d/2933) o [vincular tu tarjeta a otra subcuenta bunq](https://together.bunq.com/d/233) para completar el pago.

---

## Si realizaste un pago sin contacto:

**Límite diario excedido**  
Para proteger tus tarjetas, hemos establecido límites diarios para pagos sin contacto de **€25 por transacción** y **€50 para todas las transacciones** (cuando se alcanza esta cantidad, solo necesitas proporcionar un PIN y el contador diario se restablecerá. Cuando un [país está habilitado](https://together.bunq.com/d/2815-can-i-use-my-bunq-card-in-foreign-countries/9) en la configuración de su tarjeta, se aplicará el [límite sin contacto local](https://together.bunq.com/d/17570-travel-with-ease-contactless-limits-improvements)

Puedes encontrar más información sobre los límites diarios en este [enlace](https://together.bunq.com/d/6635).

**Necesitamos un PIN para este pago**  
Si se rechaza tu pago sin contacto y recibes el mensaje de error "PIN no recibido", significa que necesitamos tu código PIN para esta transacción. En este caso, debes intentar pagar insertando tu tarjeta en el terminal.

**La tarjeta no está activa**  
Para que se aprueben, los pagos con tarjeta deben hacerse con una tarjeta activa. Esto significa que si acabas de pedir tu tarjeta y aún no la has activado o si tu tarjeta está temporalmente congelada, el pago no se realizará. En estos casos, primero debes [activar tu tarjeta] (https://together.bunq.com/d/3985) antes de intentar pagar nuevamente.

---

## Si realizaste un pago en línea:

**Detalles incorrectos de la tarjeta**  
Si estás tratando de pagar en línea con tu tarjeta bunq y se rechaza el pago, lo primero que debes hacer es verificar nuevamente los detalles de tu tarjeta y asegurarte de haber ingresado el número de tarjeta correcto, la fecha de vencimiento y tu código CVC actual, especialmente si tienes la [función CVC giratoria](https://together.bunq.com/d/3019) activada.

Puedes encontrar los detalles de tu tarjeta [aquí](https://go.bunq.com/link/cvc) o en la aplicación en **Tarjetas**> **Selecciona la tarjeta correcta** > **Detalles de la tarjeta**

**El comerciante está bloqueado** 
 Si un pago al mismo comerciante falló más de 3 veces en una hora, bloquearemos todas las transacciones a este comerciante durante 60 minutos por razones de seguridad. Las fallas pueden ocurrir cuando llenas incorrectamente los detalles de la tarjeta o si el comerciante por alguna razón no pudo procesar la información correctamente.
En esta situación, debes esperar una hora antes de intentar a realizar otro pago a este comerciante. Asegúrate de desactivar también la [función de CVC giratorio](https://together.bunq.com/d/3019) en la configuración de tu tarjeta, para asegurarte de que el comerciante pueda usar el CVC correcto.

**Saldo insuficiente**  
Cuando intentas pagar una cantidad mayor que la que está disponible en tu cuenta, el pago no se realizará para asegurarnos de que no te endeudes. En esta situación, debes [recargar tu cuenta](https://together.bunq.com/d/2933) o [vincular tu tarjeta a otra subcuenta bunq](https://together.bunq.com/d/ 233) para completar el pago.

**La tarjeta no está activa**  
Para que se aprueben, los pagos con tarjeta deben hacerse con una tarjeta activa. Esto significa que si acabas de pedir tu tarjeta y aún no la has activado o si tu tarjeta está congelada temporalmente, el pago no se realizará. En estos casos, primero debes [activar tu tarjeta](https://together.bunq.com/d/3985) antes de intentar pagar nuevamente.

Update regarding safekeeping fee as of 1st of October 2022



Hey bunqers 

We’re happy to announce that, starting October 1st, 2022, bunq will no longer be charging any safekeeping fees on balances up to €1,000,000. Furthermore fees for balances over €1,000,000 are reduced by 50%.

At bunq we have the highest safety concerns for your money and therefore store large parts of it at the European Central Bank (ECB). Since the ECB has decided to stop charging money for deposits, we’ve immediately responded by adjusting our safekeeping fees accordingly, so that you can keep your funds secure for less 

**Therefore, as of 1st of October 2022, the following pricing is in effect:**

- For balances up to €1,000,000, we'll no longer charge any safekeeping fees.
- For balances over €1,000,000, the safekeeping fee is significantly reduced by 50% to €0.03 per day per €1,000 (rounded down). As before it only applies to your balance above €1,000,000.

**Important note**:  As of December 1, 2022, bunq will no longer be charging safekeeping fee at all! More will be announced soon  

## Example for accounts with balance below €1,000,000 

- If you have less than **€1,000,000 in your bunq account** (total of all Bank Accounts): **there's NO safekeeping fee**, since this is below the minimum amount for it. 

## Example for accounts with balance above €1,000,000 

**If you have €1,100,000 in your bunq account:** 

 - Your first €1,000,000 would be with no safekeeping fee.
 - For every €1,000 above €1,000,000 you’re charged €0.03/per day. In this case - 100 x 0.03 = €3.00/per day.
 - This makes your safekeeping fee  a total of €3.00/per day.

You can find more detailed information about our safekeeping fee as well as the pricing of other services in our [pricing sheet](https://www.bunq.com/en/pricing-sheet). 

What does the Complete status mean?

Hey bunqers  

In this topic, we'll clarify what the "Complete" status indicates, when you might encounter it. As always, we're here to make your banking experience as clear and straightforward as possible 

### What does this status mean?

- **For outgoing card payments**

For outgoing card payments, this status means that the card payment has been successful, and the merchant has already collected the money from us.

Because of that, if you need a refund for this payment, your first step would be to contact the merchant directly. If for some reason you can’t get a refund from the merchant, you can then contact us through our [Support center](https://together.bunq.com/d/40046) and ask us to reverse the payment.

Keep in mind that we’ll need to see proof of your communication with the merchant regarding the refund before we can reverse the payment for you.

- **For incoming card payments**

For incoming card payments, this status means that the payment was successfully received to your account. Therefore the status of the payment changes to “Received”. 

In the sub-account’s payment history you can see all the statuses of the payment in separate events in chronological order.

## If you made an ATM transaction 

Did you have trouble with an ATM transaction? No worries! You're covered by Mastercard's protection and you can request a refund directly in the app.

We've been offering instant payments between bunq users since 2015. In 2017 the European Payment Council (EPC) announced that 600 banks across Europe will offer Instant Payment support.  This means that sending a SEPA transfer will arrive within seconds at the other party, if they participate in the EPC Instant Payment system too. Even if it is in the evening, weekend, or holidays! Naturally, we jumped at the opportunity to be a part of this already a few years ago.

We chose to participate in the EU Instant Payment System because...well, we are an international bank based in the Netherlands. Next to that, there are instant payments with way more other banks than solely the Dutch banks. Other Dutch banks are slowly joining us on the same path of user-oriented innovation and ensuring cross-border availability, but most of them are not there yet. Instead, they integrated the Dutch Instant Payment System in spring 2019. Are you ready for the Dutch banks to join us? Yes? Us too! Because it allows you to do easy banking with family, friends, and colleagues residing in other countries!

Let’s discuss some of the details of instant payments. It’s good to know that the Instant Payments system supports payments up to €15.000. I received a garnishment on my German account 

Hey bunqers 


### What's a garnishment?

If you have an outstanding debt to an individual, institution, or entity (also known as a creditor), they may obtain a court order to recover the money you owe. This process is called garnishment. According to German law, a garnishment allows the garnishor (the party that’s owed money) to legally force the garnishee (the debtor) to fulfill their financial obligations to the relevant creditor.

## What happens if your German account received a garnishment?

#### Step 1. We’ll let you know

When we’re contacted by a creditor (a bailiff, an institution, a Creditor or acreditor’s representative) and receive the administrative enforceable documents from them, we put the bank account in question under garnishment by temporarily freezing your monetary account(s)  and inform you right away in the app.

To check your received messages from bunq you can follow these steps:

1. Go to Profile
2. Click on “See More” under Activity
3. Check out the messages sent there

#### Step 2. Seizure

First, we must have received a garnishment request by the creditor accompanied with the court order. While we’re processing the garnishment, we temporarily freeze your monetary account(s). We then transfer the funds from your account up to the amount of the debt into a special bunq intermediary account where they will be reserved for the bailiff or directly send the funds to them (if that’s stated in the order). 

In case the available funds on your account(s) are enough to settle the whole debt, we’ll reactivate your account(s) after the transfer and you can use them as usual .

However, if at the time of processing the garnishment there aren’t enough funds on the account to cover the requested amount, we will have to keep the account(s) frozen. We will also have to reserve any incoming funds up to the amount of the debt that are credited to the account after the garnishment was applied. When new funds are available, we will immediately inform the creditor of the newly seized amount. 

#### Step 3. Unfreezing your Bank Accounts

When the procedure above is completed, or we receive an explicit request from the creditor, we'll unfreeze your monetary account(s). Then you can use your bunq account as usual.

If the debt is decreased or you have settled it by means other than bunq, we must receive an official written statement from the creditor where it’s stated that the proceedings were completed and bunq is at liberty to release the monetary accounts or return any seized funds.

## When will my account be unblocked?

This depends on the instructions of the bailiff. To get your account unblocked please contact the bailiff.

## Is there an administration fee for a garnishment?

By German law, bunq is required to process every garnishment. Since this is fully regulated by the German law, we process garnishment(s) free of charge.

## I have another question about a garnishment placed on my account. Who do I contact?

We've shared the available details about the garnishment, including the file number and the creditor's name, in the garnishment announcement. For more specific advice and assistance, it would be best to reach out to the bailiff directly. They'll be able to provide you with more detailed information.

## When will my garnishment finish?

As soon as a judge ruled on the garnishment, we’ll receive the verdict and when we have the needed transfer order, we’ll immediately process all needed payments.

##How can I appeal?

As a third-party, we don't handle objections or other requests related to the garnishment. These matters are managed by the institution or the bailiff who placed the garnishment. If you have any further questions, it’ll be best to contact the bailiff about them.

## What if I have more than one garnishment?

When you have multiple garnishments your account will be blocked until all of the garnishment proceedings are completed.

Anti-Fraud Guide: Spoofing - The dynamic ways of scamming nowadays, explained  

Hey bunqers 

We strive to keep you and your money safe so that you can have the best banking experience ever. Although there are things that are out of our control, we want to keep you updated with the latest phishing and spoofing trends. You can check all the info you need regarding phishing and in particular spoofing below 

❗️ **You have suspicions regarding a phishing attempt? [Report it directly to us in our report form](https://www.bunq.com/report) and we'll investigate for you right away** ❗

**Important Note:** Always be careful with your personal data and make sure to never share it with third parties. bunq would never contact you outside of the bunq app or its official channels and ask you to install any third party softwares, give your credentials, or any personal information (phone number, email address, security code, card number, IBAN, etc.)

## What’s spoofing?

Spoofing involves disguising the source of communication to make it appear as if it comes from a trustworthy entity when, in reality, it comes from an imposter. Scammers have been known to trick their victims by sending fraudulent links via SMS, Whatsapp or email. These messages or calls are made to seem as if they’re coming explicitly from our bunq telephone number.

**❗bunq won't call you via the phone. If you have any doubts of the message/call's legitimacy, please don't provide any sensitive data to the respective person and contact us through the in-app chat or use support@bunq.com.**

## What types of Spoofing are most common?

#### Fake bunq phone calls ☎️

Fraudsters can call you and pretend they are bunq employees that want to help you by masking the number they're calling you from. By doing so, you get a call from an unknown number, or it may look like we’re calling you from our own 24/7 emergency hotline +31208083666. They may ask you to follow a link, confirm or give away personal information, download  softwares (such as TeamViewer, AnyDesk, Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), etc), make  transfers, etc. All these actions could lead to the loss of access to your account(s) and your funds.

惡 Examples of tactics used by criminals on the phone:

- Use the name of real bunq employees and ask you to check this employee's account on LinkedIn, to make sure they work for bunq.
- “Inform” you that suspicious activities were detected on your account, such as a new device being added and/or suspicious transactions being started.
- Convince you to follow their instructions immediately to keep your account safe, and pressure you to take quick action.
- Following complex processes to create a sense of credibility, such as transferring your call to other “departments”, asking you to save procedure number, etc.

❗Please be informed that we only use this number to **receive** calls from our users who need urgent assistance. **bunq will never call you.** If any suspicious activity is detected on your account, we'll apply additional restrictions and/or contact you through the bunq app.

If you receive a phone call from someone pretending to be us, please report it [here](https://www.bunq.com/report/phishing).


#### Fraudulent SMS messages 

Scammers are quite witty and creative in the ways they use to get your money. To get your attention 
and worry you enough so you follow their instructions without a second thought, they can send a wave of fake messages seemingly from bunq using alarming words and phrases such as 'Suspicious device login', 'Verification required', 'Block', etc. They will also include a link, seemingly for your convenience, that you need to simply follow in order to take quick action and protect yourself.

If you follow the link, additional instructions follow via different channels - on a fake website, or via phone call/audio call, or text message. For example, you can receive an SMS from a Belgian mobile phone, while the fraudsters then call from a Dutch number. At some point you may be asked to scan a QR code and enter your bunq login details. A text may look like this:



The fraudsters will pretend they need you to do this in order to ‘secure your account’, falsely pretending to be members of the bunq team in order to  gain access to your account, as well as all the information and assets in it.

#### Fake emails 

Similarly tactics from SMS fraud can be applied via email. A situation of urgency is insinuated and they copy bunq design and style on the email, in order to increase your chances to believe that email is legit. **Always check whether the email is sent from one of our official emails for user communication.**

If you've received an email and you're not sure if it's spoofing, check out the actual domains we use to communicate with you through email:

- @bunq.com - This is our primary domain and is used for transactional emails.
- @update.bunq.com - This subdomain is dedicated to sending bunq Update invites and general announcements.
- @hello.bunq.com - This subdomain is used for marketing communications.
- @review@bunq.com - This domain is used when we require extensive information and request additional documents from you.

## Keeping you safe

If you're still wondering how you can avoid phishing and spoofing scams, you can find out some of our tips [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/54498).

If you receive a suspicious phone call, SMS, or email from somebody who tries to persuade you they represent bunq, be sure to alert us using our [report form](https://www.bunq.com/report/phishing).

Update on our open banking API: a PSD2-compliant sandbox!

Hey bunqers  

A new regulated set of laws for banks, also known as PSD2, have been implemented by the EU. PSD2 was created as a way to get banks to open up their systems so that new fin-techs could start using them to build solutions. 

*If you would like to read about the Revised Payment Service Directive, please check out this article from [Evry](https://www.evry.com/en/news/articles/psd2-the-directive-that-will-change-banking-as-we-know-it/)*

 At bunq, we've always believed in innovation and transparency. That's why we opened up our API in 2017. This showed great success, but PSD2 has required our API to go through some changes.

We've taken the first step in this update by releasing a new sandbox environment. This lets anyone test and provide feedback for the new way our API will allow Account Information Service Providers (AISP) and Payment Initiation Service Providers (PISP) to interact with bunq accounts.

## Authentication update 

One of the major changes incorporated in the sandbox update is the new approach of how banks must authenticate payment service providers, financial business administration solutions, checkout systems, budgeting tools, invoicing software and any other AISP/PISP.

## OAuth flows

We will continue following the Dynamic Client Registration specification and the current OAuth flow. The only change is the scope of sandbox operations that are allowed through OAuth (since permissions now depend on the role of the TPP).

#### AISPs can read account information such as the following:

- legal name
- nationality
- IBAN
- card validity data
- account balance

#### Transactions PISPs are allowed to do the following:

- read account information
- initiate payments
- confirm whether there are sufficient funds available on the user's account to cover a payment initiated by the TPP. 

## Connecting to the bunq PSD2-compliant sandbox

By connecting to Sandbox, anyone can start exploring the new bunq API. Just follow the 5 steps below:

1. Create a test PSD2 certificate.
2. Get a PSD2 user by following the PSD2 authentication flow.
3. Register an OAuth application.
4. Create an additional sandbox user that will play the role of an end user.
5. Authenticate the user via OAuth.
6. Start testing!
