bunq Tips - Easily accept B2B Direct Debits, without the need for any paperwork!

Hey bunqers  

If you’re a bunq Business user, you may have noticed other users asking about B2B SDD from time to time. Even though acronyms are an easy way to name things, it’s hard to remember all of them. But no worries, we’ve got you covered on this one! Get a beverage and let us tell you what B2B SDD is and how to use it step-by-step. Let’s begin! 

### What is B2B SDD?

It stands for Business to Business SEPA Direct Debits 珞 These are payments that companies can charge to your IBAN, usually for recurring payments, such as membership fees. 

For example, you recently set up a new contract with your network provider, and they send you the monthly costs to your bunq account. However, you notice that they seem to have charged you a higher fee than you expected. Luckily, with bunq you can choose to approve or deny the Direct Debits that you receive. This means you're in full control and can always decide not to pay a direct debit.


## How does it work?

As a rule, Direct Debits are set up like "contracts" using a paper form. The SDD issuer gives you the two copies of the papers to set up the B2B Direct Debit. You need to fill out one copy by entering [your bunq IBAN](https://together.bunq.com/d/2880-how-do-i-find-my-iban/5) and send it back to the SDD issuer. The other copy is usually for the bank, but since we're not a big fan of any paper form, we've integrated this in the app. We'll send you a push notification to authorize this request. You'll have the option to accept it (for one day). The contract is formed once you've accepted the request. If no action is taken before the indicated period, the Direct Debit will expire and w'ill automatically decline it. 

We provide full freedom to you so you can make complete use of your account and any service you want to link to it.  

- This feature is only available for [Business](https://together.bunq.com/d/1014-who-can-open-a-bunq-business-account/10) users
- It's not possible to refund B2B Direct Debit, you need to contact the other party.
- All future B2B Direct Debits will be accepted automatically from the same company


## How does this work in the app?

When you open the bunq app and load the Home screen, you'll see a pending event on the top of the screen. Simply click on it and accept/decline the payment.

Depuis la mise en place de l’espace SEPA (Espace unique de paiement en Euros), les pays membres de cette convention se sont accordés sur un système reposant sur l’IBAN dans le but de simplifier les transactions internationales.
En refusant votre IBAN, commerçants ou employeurs sont en infraction selon la loi européenne du 1er Février 2016 ([art. 9, directive européenne n 260/2012](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2012:094:0022:0037:fr:PDF)).

Si vous vous retrouvez dans une situation où votre IBAN est refusé, nous vous invitons à contacter [l'autorité nationale](https://finance.ec.europa.eu/system/files/2022-10/sepa-compliance-competent-authorities_en.pdf) en vigueur en leur envoyant un maximum d’information concernant la situation, le commerçant ou l’employeur impliqué.

Your safety and well-being are our priority. We have an acceptance policy in place to abide by legal regulations and follow some of our own risk standards as a company.

Wondering if you can sign up for a business account? Check out the requirements for opening an account below:

### Who can open an account?

Here are the basic conditions you need to meet in order to open a bunq business account:

- You need to have a verified personal account with bunq.
- You as a director cannot be a minor.
- You need to run a legitimate business in Belgium .
- You need to be permanently residing in Belgium .
- Your business should operate under one of the legal forms currently accepted by bunq. Find the full list [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/9256).
- Your company’s corporate structure and activities should comply with bunq’s requirements. More details on this below.
- Your business entity cannot have more than one account with bunq.
- If your company has multiple trade names (under the same registration on the Chamber of Commerce) - you can effortlessly open a Bank Account with the different names like we explain [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/24341-trade-names-for-your-business-bank-accounts).
- If the various layers of your company are registered as separate legal entities with the Chamber of Commerce (Kamers van Koophandel or Chambres de Commerce), each one would need its own Business accounts.

Once we confirm the above-mentioned conditions are met, we need to determine whether your business entity is registered with the local Chamber of Commerce or, in specific situations, you are operating on a freelance basis. Depending on that, we require different documents in order to approve your account.

Please also keep in mind that as a bank, we are legally required to store all of our user’s personal information in a secure and protected way. If there is more than one director,  we create personal accounts for each director of the business accounts. It allows us to keep your information and your company’s information safe while complying with regulations. Check out [this topic](https://together.bunq.com/d/38241) for more information.

## Legal forms and documents

In order to open a business account with bunq, you need to provide a legal form together with a few documents. We accept the following legal forms.

- Sole proprietorship or Eenmanzaak/Enterprise Individuelle
- Limited liability companies, or Besloten Vennootschap met Beperkte Aansprakelijkheid/Société Privée à Responsabilité Limitée (BVBA/SPRL)

For each legal form, we require the following documents.

- Eenmanzaak/Enterprise Individuelle
 - Kruispuntbank van Ondernemingen (KBO) extract
- Limited liability companies (BVBA/SPRL legal form)
 - KBO extract
 - Deed of Incorporation (DOI)
 - Joint Authorisation (if the directors are jointly authorised)
 - IDs for all directors and Ultimate beneficial owners (UBOs)

Please find more information on legal documents [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/24017).

Why do I have a negative balance?



Hey bunqers  

To give you the freedom to use your account on your terms, we ensure that you can't fall into debt by not offering loans, credit or overdraft. This way you can freely use your money without the burden of debt. 
However, there are few occasions when you might have a negative balance on your bunq account. You can check them below 

### Most common reasons
 
* **Invoice fee:** the membership fee is deducted from the billing account but the funds are insufficient.
* **Card payment:** the payment amount was adjusted [due to ZeroFX](https://together.bunq.com/d/4952-save-money-when-spending-abroad-with-zerofx/2) or because the merchant collected a higher amount than initially authorised.
* **Sofort top-up:** we do not receive the money for a Sofort top-up within 2 working days. Thus, the Sofort top-up is reversed. [Learn more here](https://together.bunq.com/d/8408-why-was-my-sofort-top-up-reversed).

## Understanding your situation

You can easily check the latest payments by going to **Home** and then tapping on [**Total**](https://go.bunq.com/link/events) to understand which payment caused the negative balance exactly.

## How do I resolve my negative balance to reactivate my bunq account?

- You can transfer money to [your IBAN](https://go.bunq.com/link/ibans) from one of your other accounts that has enough funds.
- You can also use one of the other [top-up methods](https://together.bunq.com/d/2933-how-do-i-deposit-money-or-transfer-funds-to-my-account) to add money to your bunq account.

❗️As soon as you resolve your negative balance, your bunq account will be reactivated right away and you will be able to use it normally again.

## What happens when I have a negative balance?

* **Day 0:** You get notified when you log into the bunq app, and you’re asked to resolve the negative balance.
* **Day 7:** You are being reminded again when you login and we will also be sending you a reminder via email.
* **Day 14:** You are being reminded in the bunq app and via email. Your cards and API keys are temporarily deactivated.
* **Day 31:** We freeze your account after a month in debt until you resolve the outstanding balance with a deposit.
 
Once you resolve the negative balance, your account will immediately be unblocked. Have you paid your debt but are still experiencing difficulties successfully logging back into your account? Just let us know at support@bunq.com.

 ¿Experimenta discriminación IBAN? ¡Esto es lo que debes hacer!



IBAN significa Número de cuenta bancaria internacional y es un número adjunto a todas las cuentas bancarias de la UE. Puedes encontrar más información sobre ellos [aquí](https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/100214/whats-difference-between-iban-and-swift-code.asp).


## ¿Cómo se ve un IBAN?

bunq es un banco en línea con sede en Ámsterdam  por lo que el código de país al comienzo de su IBAN es NL, para los Países Bajos . Luego le sigue un número de cheque de dos dígitos, el código bancario de bunq, que son las primeras cuatro letras del código BIC / SWIFT de bunq (BUNQNL2A) y finalmente el número de cuenta de diez dígitos.

p.ej.: NLXX BUNQ XXXX XXXX XX

Puedes encontrar más información sobre los detalles de tu cuenta [aquí](https://together.bunq.com/d/2880-how-do-i-find-my-iban/5).

---


## ¿Qué IBAN se acepta?

 Como cualquier otro IBAN proporcionado por un banco dentro de la [región SEPA](https://www.ecb.europa.eu/paym/integration/retail/sepa/html/index.en.html) (Área de pago únicamente en euros), tu IBAN de bunq debe ser aceptado por comerciantes o empleadores ya que los países europeos han acordado este sistema de IBAN simplificado para facilitar las transferencias internacionales dentro de Europa.

#### ¿Qué significa esto?

Esto simplemente significa que si los comerciantes o los empleadores no quieren aceptar tu IBAN de bunq debido a su código de país, longitud o cualquier otra razón, están violando la ley europea a partir del 1 de febrero de 2016 ([Artículo 9 del Reglamento no 260/2012](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2012:094:0022:0037:en:PDF)) y haciendo lo que llamamos *discriminación IBAN*. 

---

## ¿Qué debes hacer si tu NL IBAN aún no es aceptado?

En esta situación poco probable, debes seguir los siguientes pasos:
**1.** Intenta informar al comerciante o empleador en cuestión que esto no es legal.
**2.** Si te ignoran, debes comunicarte con tu [autoridad nacional](https://finance.ec.europa.eu/system/files/2022-10/sepa-compliance-competent-authorities_en.pdf) pertinente y proporcionarles una explicación detallada de la situación con tus datos de contacto y toda la información que tienes sobre el comerciante o empleador.

Ten en cuenta que siempre es una buena idea agregar una prueba escrita del rechazo, como una copia del documento o una captura de pantalla. 

Why was my Mastercard chargeback denied?

Hey bunqers! 

Ever wondered why your chargeback was denied? This topic will give you more insights on how chargebacks are processed and the requirements that must be fulfilled 

### So, why was my Mastercard chargeback denied?

For the purpose of a successful chargeback submission to Mastercard, there are specific conditions we should meet, according to Mastercard’s rules and regulations. If your request doesn’t cover all the requirements, we have to deny your request. There are a few main reasons why your chargeback may be denied: 

## The payment is older than 120 days ⏳

When a transaction you want to refund was settled more than 120 days ago, you’re not eligible for a chargeback, therefore the request won’t be processed further. 

## We’ve already submitted or denied a chargeback for this payment 

When a chargeback request is already processed, approved or denied, a following request for the same transaction can’t be initiated/processed again.

## Over 15 fraud-related refund requests per card 

If you request over 15 transactions which appear to be fraudulent (not authorized) with the same card, following Mastercard’s regulations, we’re obligated to deny any further request for this card. 

## You have a transaction history with the merchant 欄

When you request a refund for a payment with a merchant you have previous transactions with, according to Mastercard’s rules, you’re not eligible for a chargeback due to the fact that you’ve accepted the Terms & Conditions of the merchant, therefore you must settle your dispute directly with the merchant.

## The payment was authorized via 3DS  or made via Apple/Google Pay 

When the transaction reported as unrecognized was authorized via 3D secure code or the payment was processed via Apple/Google Pay this means that you’ve personally accepted the payment. Therefore you’re not eligible for a chargeback as per Mastercard’s regulations.

## The payment was performed with a Maestro card

We are not able to process chargeback cases for Maestro card payments. The Consumer Protection from Mastercard is only applicable for payments performed with a Mastercard.

## We didn’t receive an answer from you for more than 5 days ❓

For some requests, we need additional info in order to see the full picture. Thus we simply contact you through the app and request this info from you. 

In case that you fail to provide the requested information within 5 days, we’ll automatically deny the chargeback request and close the case.

What’s EVR, and how does bunq use it?

Hey bunqers 

We always aim to keep the banking environment secure and free from fraudsters. In order to achieve that, we work with multiple governments and organizations, which ensure your banking security.

One of the steps we take to keep you and your money secure involves adding fraudsters to the EVR register.

### What’s the EVR register?

EVR is the Dutch banking External Referral Register. In this register, all banks part of the [PIFI](https://www.nvb.nl/publicaties/protocollen-regelingen-richtlijnen/protocol-incidenten-waarschuwingssysteem-financi%C3%ABle-instellingen/) are allowed to report and identify fraudulent persons. This means that once an individual is added to the register, they might have limited access to other banking or financial services in The Netherlands.

Want to learn more about the EVR register? Click [here](https://www.nvb.nl/themas/veilig-bankieren/waarschuwingsregisters-van-banken/) 

## How do you get added to the EVR? 

You may be added to the EVR if you partake in an incident of fraud and/or by not following our [Terms & Conditions](https://www.bunq.com/documents).

## I received a notification from bunq that I was added to the EVR, what’s next?

This means that you were added to the External Referral Register and, as a consequence, you might have limited access to other banking or financial services in The Netherlands.

## What data is added? 

The EVR only contains a person's name and date of birth, or a company’s owner and KvK number. This means that the register will not state publicly the reason why someone is registered. That information is only known to the security department of the financial institution that registered you. 

## There’s a mistake, I don’t recognize this fraud case! What should I do?

If you have any questions, believe that our information is incorrect or if you want to contest the registration of your details, please fill in our website form [here](https://www.bunq.com/report?dc=complaint). 

When you do, please make sure to mention  ‘EVR Reporting’ in the description of your issue. Please explain why you disagree with our decision and substantiate your explanation with relevant documents (e.g. contracts, e-mails or other correspondence, etc.)

## Was ist ein P-Konto?

Ein P-Konto (oder auch Pfändungsschutzkonto) ist eine Art Bankkonto, welches von deutschen Banken angeboten wird, das es verhindert, dass ein bestimmter Betrag von deinem Konto gepfändet wird, sollte ein Gläubiger aufgrund nicht beglichener Schulden Vollstreckungsmaßnahmen gegen dich eingeleitet haben. Somit kannst du trotz einer Kontenpfändung weiterhin deinen Lebensunterhalt bestreiten.

---

## Kann ich bei bunq ein P-Konto eröffnen?

Auch wenn wir [deutsche IBANs](https://together.bunq.com/d/43672-deutsche-ibans-hallo-deutschland) unterstützen, ist unsere Banklizenz aus den Niederlanden. Daher bieten wir derzeit keine P-Kontos an. Sollten wir einen Pfändungs- oder Vollstreckungsauftrag gegen dich erhalten, sind wir gesetzlich dazu verpflichtet, den Anweisungen der zuständigen Behörden Folge zu leisten.

Nachdem wir damit angefangen haben, jetzt auch [deutsche IBANs anzubieten](https://together.bunq.com/d/43672-deutsche-ibans-hallo-deutschland), haben uns viele unserer Nutzer*innen nach der Möglichkeit gefragt, ein P-Konto zu eröffnen. Allerdings hat sich nichts daran geändert, dass bunq eine in den Niederlanden lizenzierte Bank ist. Auch wenn wir jetzt offiziell deutsche IBANs anbieten können, sind wir gesetzlich nicht dazu befugt, P-Konten anzubieten.

---

## Wird es in der Zukunft möglich sein, ein P-Konto zu eröffnen?

Wir arbeiten immer daran, unser Angebot noch besser auf lokale Begebenheiten anzupassen und somit sicherzustellen, dass du das bestmögliche Nutzungserlebnis hast. Sollte es uns in Zukunft möglich sein, auch P-Konten anzubieten, dann werden wir euch darüber sofort sowohl an dieser Stelle als auch über die sozialen Medien darüber informieren.

---

Welche Dokumente werden benötigt, damit man ein Geschäftskonto eröffnen kann



Es freut uns zu hören dass Du ein bunq Geschäftskonto eröffnen möchtest!

Um sicherzustellen, dass Du so reibungslos wie möglich dein Konto bei uns eröffnen kannst, müssen wir hierzu, unter anderem die rechtmäßigen Eigentümer/UBOs (Ultimate Beneficial Owners) deines Unternehmens kennen.

---

## Wozu und warum müssen wir das alles wissen?

Lange rede, kurzer Sinn… Wir sind dazu gesetzlich verpflichtet!

Als Finanzinstitut müssen wir in der Lage sein, die wirtschaftlichen Eigentümer jedes Kunden einer juristischen Person identifizieren zu können, um zu vermeiden, dass die Regularien für Geldwäsche oder Terrorismusfinanzierung unabsichtlich erleichtert werden (gemäß den DNB-Regeln sowie der 4. und 5. EU-Geldwäscherichtlinie und der Europäischen Regularien.)

Aus diesem Grund musst Du uns einige Unterlagen zur Verfügung stellen. 

Wir bitten dich, uns Folgende Dokumente zu zeigen, um erfolgreich ein Geschäftskonto eröffnen zu können:

---

## Auszug der Handelskammer

Ein Auszug aus der Handelskammer oder eine Steuernummer ist dein rechtmäßiger Nachweis für deine Gewerbeanmeldung. 
In den Niederlanden nennen wir dies deine KVK-Erklärung.

Wir bitten dich, diese Informationen mit uns zu teilen, da wir bestätigen möchten, dass Du derjenige bist, von dem Sie sagen, dass Du es tatsächlich bist. 

Auf diese Weise können wir deine Unternehmensunterlagen rechtmäßig identifizieren und überprüfen. Schließlich hat Deine Sicherheit oberste Priorität.

**Was enthält ein Auszug der Handelskammer?**

- Informationen und Identifikation des Geschäftsführers.
- Informationen zu deinen Unternehmensaktivitäten und deiner Rechtsform.
- Bevollmächtigte (falls zutreffend).

---


## Gründungsurkunde / Deed of Incorporation (DOI)

Dies ist ein rechtmäßig ausgestelltes Dokument vom Notar, das die Registrierung deines Unternehmens belegt.
Wir werden dich um dieses Dokument bitten, wenn dein Auszug aus der Handelskammer nicht alle Informationen enthält, die wir zur Bestätigung deines Geschäfts benötigen.

**Was enthält die Gründungsurkunde?**

- Informationen zu deinen ausgegebenen Aktien / Geschäftsanteilen.
- Informationen zur Aufteilung der Aktien zwischen deinen Geschäftspartnern / Aktionären Ultimate Beneficial Owners (UBOs).

---

## Schriftliche Zustimmung für gemeinsam bevollmächtigte Direktoren 

Gemeinsam bevollmächtigte Direktoren (gezamenlijk bevoegd in den Niederlanden) können ohne Genehmigung aller an ihrem Geschäft beteiligten Direktoren nicht selbstständig handeln.

Wenn du versuchst, dich als gemeinsam autorisierter Direktor anzumelden, müssen wir sicherstellen, dass alle autorisierten Direktoren mit der Eröffnung des Kontos einverstanden sind. Wenn dies auf dich zutrifft, bitten wir dich, uns Folgendes mitzuteilen:

1. [Eine schriftliche Einverständniserklärung](https://www.bunq.com/assets/media/legal/en/written-consent-form.pdf), die von allen Direktoren unterzeichnet und erteilt wurde zur Eröffnung deines Geschäftskontos.
2. Ein Foto eines Ausweises (der Ausweisdokumente) von jedem gemeinsam autorisierten Direktor.

---

## Eigentümer Register / Aktionärsregister

Ein [Eigentümer Register / Aktionärsregister](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/shareholder-register.asp) ist eine Liste der rechtmäßigen Teilhaber deiner Unternehmensanteile / der aktiven Eigentümer der Aktien deines Unternehmens.

Wir bitten dich, dies anzugeben, falls eine Anteilsübertragung / Aktien Übertragung stattfindet und sich das Eigentum an deinem Unternehmen ändert. 
Auf diese Weise können wir überprüfen, ob deine Unternehmensanteile zwischen verschiedenen Parteien übertragen wurden.

---

## Wohnsitznachweis des Geschäftsführers / Direktors

Wir akzeptieren als Nachweis für deinen Wohnsitz folgende Unterlagen:

- Ein Mietvertrag (mit Unterschriften und nicht älter als 1 Jahre)
- Anmeldung bei der Gemeinde
- Aktuelle Stromrechnung (Gas, Wasser oder Strom aus den letzten 3 Monaten)

Wir akzeptieren nicht:

- Kontoauszüge
- Handyrechnungen oder andere Rechnungen
- Eigentumsnachweis einer Eigentumswohnung
- Kurzfristige Aufenthaltsgenehmigung (kürzer als 6 Monate)

Dies soll bestätigen und nachweisen, dass Du als Geschäftsführer des Unternehmens in demselben Land lebst, in dem Du dein Unternehmen führst.

---

## Was sind die Akzeptanz Richtlinien zur Eröffnung eines bunq Geschäftskontos?

Deine Sicherheit und dein Wohlbefinden sind unsere Priorität.

Wir haben eine Akzeptanz Richtlinie, um gesetzliche Vorschriften einzuhalten und einige unserer eigenen Risiko Standards als Unternehmen einzuhalten.

Nachdem du den Anmeldevorgang abgeschlossen hast, werden wir deine Bewerbung schnellstmöglich prüfen. Wir bewerten jeden Antrag einzeln, um sicherzustellen, dass jedes Unternehmen dem gleichen Standard entspricht und alle Konto Anforderungen erfüllt werden. Damit wir dein Geschäftskonto genehmigen können, müssen die Struktur und die Aktivitäten deines Unternehmens, alle hier aufgelisteten folgenden Anforderungen erfüllen:

**Unternehmens Struktur:**

Eine Unternehmensstruktur kann je nach Rechtsform und Merkmalen aus mehreren Ebenen bestehen. 

- Wir können dein Unternehmen nicht akzeptieren, wenn deine rechtliche Struktur zu komplex ist. Wir klassifizieren jedes Unternehmen, dessen Struktur mehr als 3 Schichten außerhalb unserer Akzeptanz Richtlinie liegen. Die zweite Schicht / Das zweite Level kann aus 1+ Unternehmen oder Personen bestehen, die dritte Schicht / das dritte Level  kann jedoch nur aus Personen bestehen.

- Wir können ein Unternehmen nur akzeptieren, wenn die zweite Schicht / das zweite Level im selben Land wie die erste Schicht / das erste Level registriert ist. Dies bedeutet, dass sich die gesamte Eigentümerstruktur nur in einem Land befinden kann.

*Folgendes liegt außerhalb unseres Risikoappetits und wird nicht akzeptiert:*

- Stiftungen (Stichtings), die von einer anderen juristischen Person verwaltet werden.
- Unternehmen mit Aktien von Unternehmen ohne Aktien.
- STAKs (Stichting Administratiekantoor) oder Unternehmen mit einem STAK in ihrer Eigentümerstruktur.

**Unternehmensaktivitäten:**

Wir akzeptieren keine Bewerbungen wenn dein Unternehmen Aktivitäten in einem der folgenden Bereiche betreibt:

- Kryptowährungen
- Casinos und Glücksspiel
- Finanzinstitute und andere Unternehmen, die Finanzdienstleistungen anbieten (Treuhandbüros, Market Maker, Hypotheken Agenturen, Fondsmanagement usw.)
- Immobilien Investmentvehikel (Vermietung von Immobilien / Wohn- / Nichtwohngebäuden)
- Öffentliche Einrichtungen und Regierungsstellen
- Trusts und private Investmentgesellschaften
- Edelmetalle und Mineralien
- Bergbau, Öl und Gas
- Pornografie und Sexindustrie
- Verteidigung, Waffen und Munition
- Weiche und harte Drogen (Herstellung von Tabakerzeugnissen, Großhandel von nicht verarbeitetem Tabak, Großhandel mit Tabakerzeugnissen und Raucherbedarf)
- Religiöse, politische und andere ideologische Organisationen

Anti-Fraud Guide: Belastingdienst phishing scams on the rise. How to avoid them?


Hey bunqers 

We’ve received warnings from the Belastingdienst and the Police of fraudulent attempts to impersonate the tax authorities and other government online services such as MijnOverheid or MijnDigid. For that reason, we’d like to share a couple of pro-tips on how to avoid being scammed by such phishing attacks.

Make sure that you do not click on the link you receive via SMS. You can always verify on the official Belastingdienst, MijnOverheid or MijnDigid websites if you have any payments to settle with them.

**Important things to keep in mind:**

- **The Belastingdienst never sends direct payment requests.** Debtors are contacted with payment information. You may be contacted in written form, but the Tax Authorities will never contact you via chat or email.
- Neither bunq, nor the authorities would ever ask for your personal information or login credentials via SMS, phone, or third party messenger.

## How to avoid phishing scams?

1. Don’t follow suspicious links sent to you via different channels without first checking whether they are legitimate.

2. If you want to check whether you have outstanding debt to the tax authorities or any other information in the government online services, you can visit their official online platforms:
 - Mijn Belastingdienst
 - Mijn Belastingdienst Zakelijk
 - Mijn Toeslagen
 - MijnOverheid
 - Mijn DigiD

More information can be found on the [Belastingdienst’s official website](https://www.belastingdienst.nl/wps/wcm/connect/nl/contact/content/valse-whatsapp-berichten-sms-berichten-mails-apps-brieven-of-telefoontjes).

## What should I do if I receive a phishing message like the one described here?

If you stumble upon an Authorities scam, please:

- Don’t engage with the fraudsters message and avoid following any links or instructions
- Report the case to us via our [report form](https://www.bunq.com/report/phishing), so that we can take further actions immediately
- You can also report the case to the Belastingdienst [here](https://www.belastingdienst.nl/wps/wcm/connect/bldcontentnl/standaard_functies/prive/contact/fraude_misdaad_en_misstanden_melden/valse_mail_brieven_telf_app/)

## What will happen next?

Our team works closely with other institutions and together take the needed action to have such websites down and keep everyone safe. 

### What is a Sort Code and for what do I use it for? 

A Sort Code is a six digits code, which looks like 12-34-56 and it’s used by British and Irish banks. 
Banks use these codes to identify the location of the bank where the account is held and to identify and route the money transfers to the respective bank and account.
The Sort Code of a bank is integrated and encoded in the IBAN number of the account but not in the BIC codes of the account.

Sort Codes are not to be confused with [SWIFT codes](https://together.bunq.com/d/1511-what-is-bunqs-bank-identifier-code-bic-or-swift).

## How can I find my Sort Code?

1. Tap on  Home
2. Tap on your UK sub-account
3. Find your Sort Code under "IBAN & BIC"

## Do I need a Sort Code to make a payment?

Now that we know what exactly is a Sort Code, let’s talk about bunq and if you need a Sort Code in order to [make a payment](https://together.bunq.com/d/115-how-to-make-a-payment/4). 

bunq is part of the EURO-SEPA region and for this reason you don’t need a Sort Code in order to make payments as long as you have an IBAN everything will be fine. 

Your bunq IBAN can be found in the app, you check more about this [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/2880), Travel users please follow this link [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/22399).

You don’t have to worry if your IBAN is not a UK one, our Dutch IBANs are accepted worldwide and you can use bunq IBAN to receive your salary for example. Your bunq IBAN should be accepted by merchants or employers since European countries have agreed on this simplified IBAN system to facilitate international transfers within Europe.  You can find more details [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/23003-experiencing-iban-discrimination-here-s-what-you-should-do).

The important thing is to make your payment in EURO, because we are operating in the European Economic Area and the official currency is EURO. 

Don’t worry if you don’t know how to convert your payments, our amazing partner TransferWise is here to help you!
With TransferWise you can send payments in [more than 30 currencies](https://together.bunq.com/d/5185-transferwise-currencies/2), the payment will be converted automatically in EURO. You can find more information about the payment method and how to use it [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/4957).

How does Localized Card Protection work? 

Hey bunqers 

Never worry about your card’s safety, thanks to a card that will only work where you are, based on your phone's location. If “Localized Card Protection” is on, card payments are enabled at merchants whose location is within 100km of you. This means that the physical authorization of your card payments will happen automatically based on your device’s location. 

### How do I enable “Localized Card Protection”? 

Follow these easy steps to set it up:  

1. Go to **Home** 
2. Select any of your bunq cards
3. Tap on **Settings** in the right corner of your screen
4. Click on **Allowed Countries**
5. Turn on the “Localized Card Protection” toggle 
6. Done! Your cards now only work where you are, based on your phone’s location

Please note that this feature will use your device’s location. If you haven’t given the bunq app permission to “Always Allow” location access in your phone’s settings, or if you’re offline (with a turned off internet connection), this feature won’t work, since we won’t know your phone’s location. 

## How do I set up my Allowed Countries manually?

1. Go to **Home** 
2. Tap on **Cards** 
3. Select the card you'll use
4. Tap on **Settings** in the right corner of your screen
5. Click on **Allowed Countries**
6. Select Add Country and choose the country you want to use your card in

______________

##  My card doesn’t work with “Localized Card Protection” enabled. What should I do? 

In order for the setting to work, the app needs to use your device’s current location. For that you need an active internet connection, so that the information flow is successful. However if your location is missing, or the app can’t read it - your payment might fail. But worry not - here’s what you can do in such cases: 

- **If you haven’t allowed the app to use your current location** - simply go to your phone’s app permission settings and turn on the “Always Allow” location setting. This way the bunq app can use your location consistently and therefore authorize your card payments wherever you are. Once enabled - it’ll work just fine ✨

  - Keep in mind that your device may offer different location access options, however enabling the “Always Allow” setting will provide you with the best experience! If the app has partial access to your device’s location, the app will remember the last country where your device was active. 

- **If you’re offline** - you’ll receive an SMS notification immediately, explaining why the payment failed. In such a case simply turn on the mobile data of your device / connect to an internet hotspot. Once you do, the bunq app will immediately get the info that it needs and you can redo the payment successfully. 

- **The merchant has been registered in a different location**  - Some merchants have a couple of locations and they can be registered in a different geolocation than the one you’re on. In this case, it will be better to disable the “Localized Card Protection” toggle for the time being, then try the payment again


## Good to know

- Some merchants don't provide accurate location data to us. If we don't know a merchant's geolocation, we'll use their registered country instead. Payments will be accepted if the merchant is registered in the same country as you are.

- The 100km applies in any direction.

How can I open an in-app Payment Investigation?

Hey bunqers 

Someone sent you a payment and you're still waiting for it, even though the expected time period has passed? You can open a Payment Investigation all by yourself through the app. However, before kicking off the process, see if your payment needs investigating or if it’s still within the expected timeframe 
- bunq: always instant!
- SEPA: usually instant, but can take 1-2 business days.
- SWIFT: usually 2-3 business days, but can take up to 1 week.

**Note: All payments are subject to continuous monitoring so that bunq can ensure the security of your account. This may affect the timeframes listed above.**

### How do I start a Payment Investigation for an Incoming Payment?

To start a Payment Investigation, you can follow this easy process: 

1. Go to Profile
2. Select  Support
3. Click on I have a problem with a payment 
4. Select I have a missing payment 
5.. Follow the rest of the flow 

### Can I start a Payment Investigation for an Outgoing Payment?

In bunq we aim to process outgoing payments promptly. However, please be aware that there might be a monitoring delay. To provide proof of a successful payment, you can [export a statement](deeplink) from your account and share it with the recipient.

## What info is needed for a payment investigation? 

Depending on the payment, different information is required to help us locate your funds: 

- **SEPA (SCT) / Instant payment** 

a) Sending IBAN 
b) Receiving IBAN 
c) Date of the transfer 
d) Currency and amount 
e) Payment confirmation and EBA transaction ID or EBA message ID 

- **SWIFT payment**

a) Sending IBAN 
b) Receiving IBAN 
c) Date of the transfer 
d) Currency and amount 
e) Payment confirmation and SWIFT reference (or MT103 export) - You're always welcome to request a SWIFT settlement confirmation from the sending bank to us

- **Missing card refund**

a) Original card payment
b) Acquirer reference number (ARN ID) of the refund (23 numbers)
c) Date the refund was sent 

- **Missing iDEAL payment**

a) Sending IBAN 
b) Receiving IBAN 
c) Amount and date
d) Payment confirmation

- **Wise and 

a) Sending IBAN 
b) Receiving IBAN 
c) Amount and date
d) Confirmation (can be a screenshot in the app that shows the amount in EUR and the amount in the other currency)
d) Wise transaction ID 

- **Currencycloud**

a) Sending IBAN 
b) Receiving IBAN 
c) Amount and date
d) Confirmation (can be a screenshot that shows the amount)
d) Payment reference

## What’s an EBA ID?
EBA ID or "European Banking Association ID" is a unique transfer ID. Every transfer you make has this ID, so that it can be recognized by every European bank. 

If you’ve sent a SEPA transfer and it hasn't arrived within 2 business days, you can request this ID from the sending bank and provide it to the receiving bank. This way they can trace the payment. 

## What’s an ARN ID?
ARN ID or “Acquirer Reference Number“ is another payment ID and is a unique number assigned to a card transaction as it moves through the payment flow. The ARN can be used to track a payment or a refund you’ve made.

In case you’re asked for  an ARN ID, you can request it from the sending bank and provide it wherever is needed. 

## What happens after I’ve submitted the Payment Investigation?

Hey bunqers  

Enjoy effortless budgeting while automatically splitting your payments between Bank Accounts! This feature helps with budgeting directly from the source! Once you get paid, you choose how much you’d like to transfer between Bank Accounts.


### What is a Payment Sorter? 

Automagically let incoming payments flow to Bank Accounts, your savings goals or any IBAN from any bank. Be it your landlady, a charity close to your heart or the ski trip you're saving up for, you're sorted month after month! 


## How does the Payment sorter work in the bunq app? 
This feature can be used for any recurring incoming payment, like a salary or a payment made regularly from a friend, relative or organization. 
When you receive this payment, you only need to set it up once, and that’s it. You can also enable it at another time by following the steps below:

3. Select the transaction to be sorted
4. Select **Sort**
5. Select **Next** 
6. Select the **amount** you want to be forwarded to the different account and confirm. **While choosing the amounts you can choose to sort by % or amount.**

You can check all your sorted payments by going to the desired Bank Account and tapping on **Settings** in the right corner of your screen. Select **Auto Sorted Payments**.

That’s not a problem! As long as the amount is high enough to make the sorting possible, the payment sorter will do its job and transfer the amounts you chose to all the Bank Accounts concerned.

## If the payment failed and there's no event in your bunq app

## Cash withdrawals

Personal Users

 -  Account verified less than 3 months ago: €250 per calendar day, per person
 -  Account verified longer than 3 months ago: €1000 per calendar day, per person

Business Users

- Maximum limit: €1000 per card, per day

## Contactless payments

There's a **€50 limit per contactless payment** in:

Your **PIN** will be requested **after 5 contactless payments** or when you've made contactless payments for more than 150 EUR (cumulative). So if the 4th contactless payment makes the sum of the 4 payments higher than 150 EUR, the PIN will be requested.

I have a failed payment due to 3DS2, now what?

Hey bunqers 

We want to let you know about an important update that we’ve just rolled out!

It’s called **3DS2,** and it’s the new security standard for e-commerce transactions. We’ve added this feature in order to ensure the highest standards of fraud prevention for you. Online card payments are now more secure than ever!  

### I have a failed payment, now what?

Firstly, make sure that your payment was indeed denied due to 3DS2. To do so, go to your payment Event and check the reason for failure. It is right below the payment amount 

If you see _Your payment was declined due to 3DS Secure Authentication failure_ then this is indeed a case of soft decline.

To adjust this in a few easy taps, simply **enable [Auto Accept](https://together.bunq.com/d/45244)** and try again! The payment should be paid correctly this time.

---

As of the 1st January 2021, new regulations have come into effect that aim to increase the safety and security of card payments all across Europe. These new regulations are part of Europe’s PSD2, which seeks to improve the security of payments, boost innovation and help banks across Europe with modernising and adapting to new services. As part of the process to continue to modernise and ensure the highest safety standards, 3DS2 was introduced. 

---

## What is 3DS2?

**3DS2** is a type of security feature known as Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) or two-step verification. This type of verification ensures that you, the card holder, are the one performing the payment and no one else 亮 

All that’s required from you is to "_Accept_" or "_Deny_" the transaction via push notification. That’s it!  

We brought this security standard to our users in December 2020 and made sure that with bunq, it would be a quick and easy feature. With this new high-end security feature, users can authorise online card payments through a push notification from the bunq app. Once you’ve approved the purchase, you’re done! We’ve made it easier and faster than ever to approve your purchases 

## How do these rules impact me? 

Luckily, most of our users won’t notice the changes and can continue to do payments as usual.  In some rare cases, you might come across a failed card payment because the merchant doesn’t process the payment using the most recent and highest security standards. We believe in transparency, which is why we have implemented a text to notify you about online payments that failed because they didn’t meet that high security standard. 

As it’s required for us to decline these unsafe payments, you might encounter a failed payment for certain online transactions. We’re always looking for ways to improve your banking experience, but of course the safety of your money comes first   

If you encounter any problems, please [reach out to our Support team](https://go.bunq.com/link/support).

## **Quando posso avere un rimborso?**
Hai bisogno di un rimborso per un pagamento?

Alcuni pagamenti sono definitivi, mentre altri possono essere rimborsati. Questo dipende dal tipo di pagamento, ognuno ha le proprie regole.

bunq può rimborsare solo **pagamenti con carta** e **addebiti diretti**, con alcune condizioni.

---
 
## **Rimborsi per pagamenti con carta**

Per richiedere un rimborso per un pagamento con carta, segui questi passi nella tua app bunq:

1. Vai alla scheda **Home**
2. Seleziona il **conto** da cui è stato effettuato il pagamento
3. Tocca il **pagamento con carta** che desideri rimborsare
4. Tocca **Hai bisogno di aiuto con questo pagamento?**
5. Seleziona **Ho dei problemi con questo pagamento**
6. Seleziona **Ho bisogno di un rimborso**
7.Seleziona **Richiedi un rimborso**
8. Tocca **Ok** e la tua richiesta verrà inviata

Riceverai notizie sulla tua richiesta di rimborso entro 7 giorni!

Puoi anche dare un'occhiata qui sotto per vedere come richiedere un rimborso:

[center]
[/center]


Ricorda:

- Quando un pagamento con carta è stato rimborsato da bunq, è possibile che il commerciante contesti il rimborso e che quindi il pagamento ti venga addebitato nuovamente. In tal caso può anche essere addebitata una [commissione](https://www.bunq.com/it/pricing-sheet).
- Se i fondi vengono temporaneamente trattenuti sulla carta, ad esempio per una camera d'albergo o un noleggio auto, l'importo verrà rimborsato dopo 30 giorni.

---

## **Rimborsi per addebiti diretti**

Se hai bisogno di un rimborso per [un addebito diretto](https://together.bunq.com/d/5873-how-do-i-request-a-refund-for-a-direct-debit), tieni presente quanto segue:

- Devi essere il **proprietario del conto** per richiedere il rimborso.
- Puoi richiedere un rimborso solo **entro 56 giorni** dalla data dell'addebito diretto.
- Non è possibile richiedere un rimborso per gli addebiti diretti B2B (business-to-business).
 
Per richiedere un rimborso per un addebito diretto, segui questi passi nella tua app bunq:

1. Vai alla scheda **Home**
2. Seleziona il **conto** da cui è stato effettuato l'addebito diretto
3. Seleziona l'addebito diretto che vuoi rimborsato

How to update my Business account's documents?

Hey bunqers 

Every business' activities evolve and develop with time, and there's nothing we love more than to see our users succeed in their business ventures. 

To make sure we're compliant with banking regulations and safeguard the security of your account, we're legally required to make sure we have the most up-to-date info on your business. That’s why you may receive a request in your bunq app asking for recent copies of specific documents. 

### How do I update my Business account’s documents?

When you receive a request to update your documents in the app, simply follow these steps: 

1. Go to Home
2. Check the Events on top 
3. Click on the relevant event 
4. Provide the documents requested in the flow ✅

## What do I need to provide? 

### Documents

The types of documents we ask you to update aren’t any different from the documents you’ve uploaded when verifying your account. It’s possible that we ask you for one (or more) of the following documents: 

- Chamber of Commerce excerpt
- Deed of Incorporation
- Written consent for jointly authorized directors
- Shareholders registry
- Director’s proof of residence
- Company owner ID
- Director authorisation 

Learn all about the documents above [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/24017) and [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/23102) 

### Activities 

At bunq, we make sure your money is 100% safe and follow regulatory procedures in order to do so. As part of our Know Your Customer (KYC) duties, we may reach out to you in the future for some additional account information. You can learn more about this [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/9256)

## What happens after? 

Once you’ve provided your documents, our agents will review the information you’ve provided and update it for you. Once all is done, you’ll be notified right away! 

If something additional is needed or missing, we’ll make sure to let you know right away through the in-app chat (you can find it in your Profile tab’s activity on top).

How do I receive money in my Local Currency account?


You can find your account details in the app, like your IBAN. 
- The Local Currency IBAN is a **UK IBAN** and has a BIC/SWIFT code: **TCCLGB3LXXX**.

When someone sends money to your Local Currency account, this is mostly a SWIFT payment. It takes time for these payments to arrive. SWIFT payments can take up to 5 days. There are also fees involved in receiving a SWIFT payment. You can learn more about this [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/46469)

For GBP accounts, you have local account details in addition to your IBAN. If someone sends Pounds using these account details, it's processed as a Faster Payment (FPS), which is way faster and cheaper than a SWIFT payment. A local account transfer in GBP arrives in seconds! 

Now you can also do USD transfers faster than ever - find the ACH routing number for your USD account by following the easy steps explained [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/2880)

- **Important note:** As of June 24, 2022, users from Latvia , Lithuania  and Poland  with already active Local Currencies Bank Accounts won't be able to receive payments or transfers there due to service restrictions based on our [Acceptance Policy](https://together.bunq.com/d/1015). 
- **Important note**: As of August 3, 2022, users from Bulgaria  with already active Local Currencies Bank Accounts won’t be able to receive payments or transfers there due to service restrictions based on our [Acceptance Policy](https://together.bunq.com/d/1015). 

## Limits and bouncing fees for incoming payments

- **Limits**
To keep local currencies safe and available at all times, incoming transactions over £90.000,00 can't be processed and are returned sender. 

- **Bounce fees**
For an incoming payment that’s bounced, transaction costs apply. These cost are deducted from the payment upon return

## Can I receive all kinds of currency payments on my Local Currency account? 
Indeed! As of July 4, 2022 you're able to receive payments in different currencies to your Local Currencies account and we'll do the conversion for you. Example: You were sent 10 EUR to your USD account, what's gonna happen is that we'll automatically convert the transfer and you'll receive 12 USD (based on Currencycloud's conversion rate for the day)

If you see payments in your account you don’t recognize, we ask you to follow these steps, so we can help you receive the refund the best way.

How is my MassInterest calculated and paid out?

Hey bunqers 

As you know, with [bunq MassInterest](https://together.bunq.com/d/8298) you receive an interest rate higher than traditional banks:

#### Personal Accounts

- For  Dutch,  Irish and  Spanish residents: 2.46%
- For  New German users, who signed up before October 19: 2.55% for the first 4 months, afterwards: 1.56%
- For  New German users, who signed up on/after October 19: 3.85% for the first 4 months, afterwards: 1.56%
- For  Rest of the EEA residents: 1.56%
- For  USD and  GBP Savings Accounts: 3.71%

#### Business Accounts

- For  All EEA residents: 1.05%
- For  USD and  GBP Savings Accounts: 2.3%

Wondering how it’s calculated and how you can foresee your annual MassInterest Rate? Learn more below.

## How do we calculate MassInterest? 

We take the interest rate, divide it by the number of days in the year, to get a daily interest rate (a leap year has 366 days). Then your interest is calculated **every day at 23:59 CET** and this is what happens: 

- We start by taking all the Savings Accounts you have per currency;
- We take the balances of all accounts;
- We get all the payments made and received during the day;
- Based on the payments, we calculate what **your lowest total balance of your Savings Accounts** was during the day;
- If you have a Joint Savings Account (fully, legally shared between multiple people), we divide the balance of the account equally by the number of owners;
- In a leap year, you'll get a lower interest rate because it has 366 days. Keep in mind that the examples provided below are based on a regular year of 365 days.

Afterwards, you’ll receive your weekly interest (calculated based on the daily interest rates you’ve had during the past week) on your weekly Payday. Further information on how to find it can be seen [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/57060).  

* In case of a disabled Payday toggle, you won’t receive MassInterest.

* In case of a negative balance in any of your sub-accounts, we sum up the total balance of your account. If the total balance of your account is negative, the interest balance is zero for each day until resolved. 

* If you don’t have enough balance in your Savings Account to generate €0.01, MassInterest won’t be received. 

## How do I calculate MassInterest for a Personal Account? 

The 1.56% (**2.46%** for Dutch, Irish and Spanish residents), 3.71% ( for Multi-Currency Personal Savings Accounts), 2.3% ( for Multi-Currency Business Savings Accounts), and 1.05% (for Business accounts) interest rates are  annual ones.

#### If you're a  Dutch,  Irish and  Spanish residents

You get 2.46% MassInterest. If you have €100,000 in your bunq Savings Account every day, you’ll get €2,460 per year. The interest you earn will be calculated and accrued daily but paid out weekly. This makes €2,460 / 365 = €6.74 per day. Thus, you’ll earn €6.74 x 7 days = €47.18 per week.


####  If you're from any other European country

You get 1.56% MassInterest.If you have €100,000 in your bunq Savings Account every day, you’ll get €1,560 per year. The interest you earn will be calculated and accrued daily but paid out weekly. This makes €1,560 / 365 = €4.27 per day. Thus, you’ll earn €4.27 x 7 days = €29.89 per week.


####  If you’re a new bunq user and German resident
 
New German users who signed up on/after October 19, 2023 get 3.85% MassInterest. If you have €100,000 in your bunq Savings Account every day **for the first 4 months**, then you’ll get €320.83 per month [total of €1,283.32 for the whole 4-month period]. The interest you earn will be calculated and accrued daily but paid out weekly. This makes €1,283.32 / 119 days (17 weeks) = €10.78 per day. Thus, you’ll earn €10.78 x 7 days = 75.46 per week. 

**However, if you’ve registered before October 19, 2023, the interest rate applied on your account for the first 4 months will be 2.55% and your calculation will look like this:**

If you have €100,000 in your bunq Savings Account every day **for the first 4 months**, then you’ll get €212.5 per month [total of €850 for the whole 4-month period]. The interest you earn will be calculated and accrued daily but paid out weekly. This makes €850 / 119 days (17 weeks) = €7.14 per day. Thus, you’ll earn €7.14 x 7 days = €49.98 per week. 

Once the 4-month promotion period has ended, your MassInterest rate will be 1.56% - you can see how the calculation would change in the section above. 

#### If you’re saving in  USD and  GBP from a Personal accounts

Users who save in  USD and  GBP in their Personal accounts get 3.71% MassInterest. If you have $/￡100,000 in your bunq Savings Account every day, you’ll get $/￡3,710 per year. The interest you earn will be calculated and accrued daily but paid out weekly. This makes $/￡3,710 / 365 = €10.16 per day. Thus, you’ll earn €10.16 x 7 days = €71.12 per week.

## How do I calculate MassInterest for a Business Account? 

The 1.05% interest rate is an annual interest rate for your Business Savings Account. 

* The 1.05% interest rate is an annual interest rate for your Business Savings Account. When you have €100.000 on your bunq Savings Account every day, then you get €1050 per year.
* The day in which you will be paid your interest can be seen in your [Payday](https://together.bunq.com/d/57060). 

The interest you earn will be calculated and accrued daily but paid out weekly. This makes €1,050 / 365 = €2.87 per day. Thus, you’ll earn €2.87 x 7 days = €20.09 per week.

#### If you’re saving in  USD and  GBP from a Business accounts

Users who save in  USD and  GBP in their Business accounts get 2.3% MassInterest.  If you have $/￡100,000 on your bunq Savings Account every day, then you get $/￡2,300 per year. The interest you earn will be calculated and accrued daily but paid out weekly. This makes €2,300 / 365 = €6.30 per day. Thus, you’ll earn €6.30 x 7 days = €44.1 per week.

## How do I calculate MassInterest for Joint Savings Account [part of Personal Account]? 

Every member is receiving the [interest rate which applies to them as per country and Savings Account currency](https://together.bunq.com/d/57041) for an equally divided part of the total amount from all funds in the Joint Savings Account.

If your Joint Savings Account receives a weekly interest rate of €100 and you co-own it with one more friend you'll each receive interest for €50 each (the interest earned on your Joint Savings Account divided by two).

Keep in mind that for your individual Personal Account you can receive MassInterest up to €100,000. This limit covers your Personal Savings Account/s as well as your Joint Savings Account/s.

## What’s the minimum amount I need to have in my Savings Account?

####  If you're a  Dutch,  Irish and  Spanish residents

To receive MassInterest, the funds you have in your Savings Account must be able to generate an interest of €0.01 on a daily basis. If the annual interest rate is 2.46%, the daily interest rate will be 2.46% / 365 = 0.00673973%. You should have at least €149 to generate €149 x 0.00673973% = €0.01 interest rate daily.

To receive MassInterest, the funds you have in your Savings Account must be able to generate an interest of €0.01 on a daily basis. If the annual interest rate is 1.56%, the daily interest rate will be 1.56% / 365 = 0.00427397%. You should have at least €234 to generate €234 x 0.00427397% = €0.01 interest rate daily. 

####  If you’re a German resident

**First 4 months**
 
To receive MassInterest, the funds you have in your Savings Account must be able to generate an interest of €0.01 on a daily basis. If the annual interest rate is 3.85% **for the first 4 months**, the daily interest rate will be 3.85% / 365 = 0.01054795%. You should have at least €95 to generate €95 x 0.01054795% = €0.01 interest rate daily. 

If you’ve registered before **October 19, 2023**, the interest rate you’ll receive **for the first 4 months**. The daily interest rate will be 2.55% / 365 = 0.0069863%. Thus, you should have at least €144 to generate €144 x 0.0069863% = €0.01 interest rate daily.

**After the promo period**

Once the 4-month promotion period has ended, your MassInterest rate will be 1.56% - you can see how the calculation would change in the section above. 

#### If you’re saving in  USD and  GBP from a Personal accounts

To receive MassInterest, the funds you have in your Savings Account must be able to generate an interest of €0.01 on a daily basis. If the annual interest rate is 3.71%, the daily interest rate will be 3.71% / 365 = 0.01016438%. You should have at least €99 to generate €99 x 0.01016438% = €0.01 interest rate daily. 

#### If you’re saving in  USD and  GBP from a Business accounts

To receive MassInterest, the funds you have in your Savings Account must be able to generate an interest of €0.01 on a daily basis. If the annual interest rate is 2.3%, the daily interest rate will be 2.3% / 365 = 0.00630137%. You should have at least €159 to generate €159 x 0.00630137% = €0.01 interest rate daily.

 Geolokalisierung und Adressbestätigung erklärt



Wenn du ein Konto bei uns eröffnest, kriegst du die Möglichkeit deine Adresse zu bestätigen. In diesem Artikel wird erklärt, warum wir das abfragen und benötigen und wie du deine Adresse bestätigen kannst.
___

## Warum muss ich meine Adresse bestätigen?
Als Bank müssen wir verschiedene Gesetze einhalten, um dich und deine Gelder zu schützen. In einigen Fällen, müssen wir eine Adresse entweder durch eine Geolokalieserung oder ein offizielles Dokument bestätigen.
___

## Wie funktioniert es?
Es gibt verschiedene Möglichkeiten, eine Adresse zu überprüfen. Dies gibt uns eine Möglichkeit um dein Standort mit der Adresse abzugleichen, die du bei deiner Registrierung angegeben hast.

Wenn das für uns nicht genügend ist, dann fragen wir dich, zusätzliche Dokumente als Nachweis deiner Adresse uns zu schicken.
___

## Welche Dokumente akzeptieren wir?
Bisher akzeptieren wir die folgenden Dokumente als Adressnachweis:

- Eine Aufenthaltserlaubnis, die vor weniger als 6 Monaten ausgestellt wurde
- Stromrechnung für Heizung, Wasser oder Strom, nicht älter als 3 Monate
- Mietverträge, nicht älter als 6 Monate
- Nachweis der Registrierung bei deiner Gemeinde oder einem Rathaus, nicht älter als 1 Jahr
- Nachweis einer Einschreibung in Schule / Universität, für das laufende Schuljahr

Was kann ich machen, wenn ich keine von der oben aufgeführten Dokumente habe? Wir werden dich nur um ein Dokument fragen, wenn wir gesetzlich dazu verpflichtet sind. Wenn du uns nicht das Dokument zur Verfügung kann stellen, dann können wir kein Konto für dich eröffnen.

Wir **akzeptieren keine** Dokumente als Adressnachweis wie:

- Kontoauszüge
- Handy- Telefonrechnungen oder andere Rechnungen
- Arbeitsverträge
- Eigentumsnachweis
- Nachweis eines vorübergehenden Aufenthalts
- Adresse auf einem Ausweis / Reisepass
- Gehaltsabrechnungen

**Denk bitte daran, dass wir den Adressnachweis nur dann akzeptieren können, wenn die folgende Information auf dem Dokument zu finden ist:**

dein Name
die vollständige Adresse
das Ausstellungsdatum des Dokuments
deine Unterschrift und diese von dem Vermieter auf einem Mietvertrag
das Logo des Unternehmens auf eine Rechnung für Strom, Heizung oder Wasser

Wir können nur Fotos von dem originellen Dokument oder eine PDF-Version davon akzeptieren. Wir verstehen, dass es manchmal schwierig sein kann, neue Stromrechnungen zu uns weiterzuleiten, weil diese in dem Namen von jemand anderem sein können, deshalb kannst du immer ein Dokument als Bestätigung von deiner Adresse von deiner Gemeinde oder deinem Rathaus anfragen. What are the accepted company structures for a bunq Business account?

Hey bunqers  

A corporate structure can consist of many layers, depending on its legal form and characteristics. All companies in the corporate structure have to be one of our accepted legal forms.

### What type of structures we accept?

We currently cater to small and mid-sized businesses. We can only open a bunq Business account for you if: 

- your company structure has no more than 3 layers.
- the second layer only consists of more than one company or person.
- the third layer only include people. 
- a company is directly controlled by the UBO, and all layers in the same EEA country.
- a company has a “straight-line” 3-layer structure and all its layers in the same country for businesses registered outside the Netherlands.

## Which structures are considered complex?

If your legal structure is too complex, we can't accept your company. The following currently fall outside of our risk appetite and won't be accepted:

- Unclear ownership structures that are not easily traceable and with no clear understanding who the UBO is
- Companies owned by other companies in different countries
- Businesses with more than 2 ownership layers between the company for which the account is opened and the UBO

#### The following Dutch legal forms are considered complex:

- Foundations (Stichtingen) not managed by a natural person.
- Any legal entity managed by a Stichting.
- Companies with shares owned by companies without shares.
- STAKs (Stichting Administratiekantoor) or companies with a STAK in their ownership structure.
- Companies whose second layer includes one or more companies which are not a Besloten Vennootschap (or a foreign equivalent)
- Stichting Derdengelden

When will my outgoing payment arrive?

Hey bunqers 

Bank transfers between banks in the [SEPA Region](https://www.ecb.europa.eu/paym/integration/retail/sepa/html/index.en.html) usually take **1 or 2 business days** to arrive at the recipient. 

### What happens with the payment when I send it?

When you **send a payment** from your bunq account, we'll process it right away and send it to the receiving bank. It can then take a couple of days for the payment to be processed into the receiving bank account.

When you send a payment from your bunq account,  an estimated arrival time is displayed for the transfer. You can see this within your payment confirmation screen.

## SEPA

- **It usually takes 1-2 working days** for a SEPA bank transfer to be processed by the receiving bank and appear on the recipient's bank account. However, in some cases, the receiving bank determines when the money is credited to the beneficiary account. We have no influence over when payments to other banks will effectively be credited on the beneficiary account. 
 *Note*: Transactions done after 15:25 on a weekday will be processed on the next working day.
- If the payment isn't received after 2 working days, you can [export a transaction confirmation](https://together.bunq.com/d/11710) and share it with the receiving bank, to allow the receiving bank to locate the payment in their systems and process it correctly.

Your safety and well-being are our priority. We have an acceptance policy in place to abide by legal regulations and follow some of our own risk standards as a company.

After you complete the sign-up process in 5 minutes, we'll quickly review your application. We assess each application individually to make sure every company is held to the same standard and fulfils all requirements.

bunq [Easy Savings](https://together.bunq.com/d/48095), [Easy Bank](https://together.bunq.com/d/44002-easy-bank), [Easy Money](https://www.bunq.com/business) and [Easy Green](https://together.bunq.com/d/26307) let you save time, so you can focus on what's truly important: your business. Wondering if you can sign up for a business account? Check out the requirements for opening an account below:

### Who can open an account?

Here are the basic conditions you need to meet in order to open a bunq business account:

- You need to have a verified personal account with bunq.
- You as a director cannot be a minor.
- You need to run a legitimate business in Spain
- You need to be permanently residing in Spain
- Your business should operate under one of the legal forms currently accepted by bunq. Find the full list [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/9256).
- Your company’s corporate structure and activities should comply with bunq’s requirements. More details on this below.
- Your business entity cannot have more than one account with bunq.
- If your company has multiple trade names (under the same registration on the Chamber of Commerce) - you can effortlessly open a Bank Account with the different names like we explain [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/24341-trade-names-for-your-business-bank-accounts).
- If the various layers of your company are registered as separate legal entities with the Chamber of Commerce (Cámara de Comercio), each one would need its own Business accounts.

Once we confirm the above-mentioned conditions are met, we need to determine whether your business entity is registered with the local Chamber of Commerce or, in specific situations, you are operating on a freelance basis. Depending on that, we require different documents in order to approve your account.

Please also keep in mind that as a bank, we are legally required to store all of our user’s personal information in a secure and protected way. If there is more than one director,  we create personal accounts for each director of the business accounts. It allows us to keep your information and your company’s information safe while complying with regulations. Check out [this topic](https://together.bunq.com/d/38241) for more information.

- Sociedad Limitada - you should provide us with Certificate of Beneficial Owner (the name should be similar to "ACTA DE IDENTIFICACIÓN DE TITULAR REAL") and the Deed of Incorporation upon signup.
- Deed of Incorporation (DOI)
- Joint Authorisation if the company has more than one director
- CoC excerpt
- IDs of all directors and Ultimate Beneficial Owners (UBOs)
- Empresario Autónomo

Please find more information on legal documents [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/24017).

## Future payments 
Allow a payment from the payer to be sorted if the sorting is possible. This means that the future payment sorting will be executed if the payment amount is higher than the money moving from the principal account to the other Bank Accounts.

- Example:
Amount to sort: €2.500,00
Savings: €800,00
Fun stuff: €250,00
Groceries : €150,00
Remainder left in Main account: €1300,00

Any payment in the future will be sorted **if** the payment **is more** than €1.200,00

## Payments that can't be sorted
1. Switch service SCTs
2. iDeal
3. SOFORT
4. Requests

---

 ## Good to know
- Available for Easy Money and Easy Green users
- You'll be able to choose between percentage or amount while sorting the payment.
- You're able to split incoming payments of more than €1.00 into multiple Bank Accounts, these can be regular Bank Accounts and savings accounts.
- You can set this up for recurring payments as well to avoid splitting payments every week/month.
- You can cancel this as well if you like, from the event screen or the sort screen.
- You're asked whether you want to automatically sort this payment in the future.
- You're also able to select autosave accounts and regular Bank Accounts. But no AutoVAT accounts.
- If you receive a payment you want to sort but you only have 1 Bank Account, the app will prompt you to create more Bank Accounts.
- Once the payment is sorted you'll see the complete, unsorted amount in the events overview. Beneath the complete amount in blue you'll see a smaller amount and sign showing that it was sorted.
- Once the amount is sorted you can select the payment to see to which Bank Accounts the payments ended up in.
- When you set up sorting for a recurring payment, but one of the designated Bank Accounts is closed, the money will move to the remainder account. Other payments will go through as intended.
- You can edit the amounts that'll be moved in the future sorting. You just click on the payment event screen to adjust this. This can also be changed from the sort screen.
- You can automatically sort up to 20 payments.

IBAN Discrimination - Report it now!



Hey bunqers 

Our job here at bunq is to empower you to be free and make life easy for you. This is why we provide you extra security, easy and fast processes and fast support. But much too often, we started receiving more and more cases of IBAN discrimination. 

This happens especially when  businesses in the EU refuse to accept your IBAN because they need an IBAN from the country they're based in. This kind of discrimination is actually **illegal**. 

That’s why we join Wise, Klarna, N26, SumUp and Revolut in a fight against “IBAN discrimination”. And you can help us!

### How can I help? 

If you’re experiencing  IBAN discrimination, you can report your case on this platform: **https://www.acceptmyiban.org/**

Once you report the case there, we’ll do the job for you by passing your report to the responsible authorities. No need to think about which form you should choose, and all kinds of hassle, we handle it for you! 


## Know your rights

Like any other IBAN provided by a bank within the SEPA region (Single Euro Payment Area), your bunq IBAN should be accepted by merchants or employers, since European countries have agreed on this simplified IBAN system to facilitate international transfers within Europe.

This simply means that if merchants or employers don’t want to accept your bunq IBAN because of its country code, length or any other reason, they are violating European law as of 1 February 2016 (Article 9 of Regulation No 260/2012) and doing what we call IBAN discrimination.

## Possible workaround - Local IBANs! 

If the discriminating party has Dutch, German, French, Spanish or Irish origin, you can always provide them with a Local IBAN created by bunq and therefore have it accepted right away. Simply follow the easy steps explained [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/45253) to create a Local IBAN and resolve the issue right away.

Of course, don't forget to report your case of discrimination as explained above 

Anti-Fraud Guide: Fraudulent verification requests on Marktplaats

Hey bunqers 

Scammers are also active on Marktplaats and approach unsuspecting sellers or buyers via WhatsApp with so-called verification requests.

### What will actually happen?

- You're selling something on Marktplaats;
- Scammer pretends they wanna buy it;
- Scammer convinces you via chat that you need to click on a verification link and give them the 6-digit code you receive in order for the payment to go through;
- You click on the link, give out the 6 digits and lose access to the account.

You can learn more about this frequent criminal behaviour [here](https://opgelicht.avrotros.nl/alerts/artikel/oplichters-actief-op-marktplaats-verificatieverzoek-is-gevaarlijke-phishing/).

## How can I recognize this type of fraud?

First, we’d like to emphasize that if something sounds too good to be true, it’s usually because it isn’t. Always check the market value of the product you want to purchase. If the price of the offered product is too low, this can be a sign that there’s a fraudster at work.

**Important:** No institution, bank, or third party should ever request your unique credentials or access code to enter the bunq app. If someone is approaching you with a similar request, please be alert, as this is most likely fraud.

Other types of fraud have been explained [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/40318), so please make sure to double-check the information and help us keep you and the world safe.

What's my CO2 Footprint?

Hey bunqers 

The Green Tab makes it easy for you to track the CO2 Footprint of your spending. Discover which categories are adding to your carbon emissions and see how your impact changes month by month. With the Green Tab, it’s easier than ever to start spending sustainably. 

### Where can I see my CO2 Footprint?

1. Go to your  Green tab
2. Scroll down to the “Your CO2 Footprint” graph
3. You can also tap on “View Details” to see a detailed breakdown of your CO2 Footprint per category


Additionally, with every payment you make, you can see the exact CO2 contribution of that payment. To do so, you just need to tap on the payment event in the relevant Bank Account. 

## How is my CO2 Footprint calculated?

Whenever you make a payment using your bunq account, you get insights on the carbon Footprint of your purchase. To calculate this carbon Footprint, we consider the country in which you made the payment, the payment category (e.g. Groceries, Travel, Fashion), the merchant, and how much you spent. To give you the most accurate insights, our method draws from an enormous amount of statistical data. Of course, each and every transaction is unique and the carbon Footprint you see in the app will not be 100% accurate. Instead it’s intended as a reliable estimate that helps you make informed decisions on how to live more sustainably.

## Good to know

- It’s important to note that the CO2 Footprint calculated is an estimate, not an exact measurement. We derive the estimate from an average within a category of goods/services and transaction value. However, the individual items in your shopping basket aren’t known to us. 

- Only payments made via card, iDeal, and direct debits will get a CO2 Footprint. 

- Your Footprint data is exclusively used to generate your carbon Footprint for your Insights and is not utilized for any other purposes.

How do I solve a failed online payment?

Hey bunqers  

We understand that encountering a failed online payment can be a bit frustrating. But don't worry, we're here to help! 

In this topic, we'll guide you through the steps to troubleshoot and resolve common issues that might cause an online payment to fail. We'll also provide some insights into what different error messages might mean. 

## Wrong Card details 

If you're trying to pay online with your bunq card and the payment is declined, the first thing to do would be checking again your card details and make sure you entered the correct card number, expiry date and you current CVC code, especially if you've the [rotating CVC feature](https://together.bunq.com/d/3019) on. 

You can find your card details [here](https://go.bunq.com/link/cvc) or in the app under **Cards** >  **Select the right card** > **Card details** 

## Merchant is blocked 

 If a payment to the same merchant failed more than 3 times within an hour, we'll block all transactions to this merchant for 60 minutes for security reasons. The failures can happen when you filled the card details incorrectly or if the merchant for some reason couldn’t process the information properly.
 
In this situation, you should wait an hour before you try to make another payment to this merchant. Be sure to turn off the [rotating CVC feature](https://together.bunq.com/d/3019) in your card settings, which allows the merchant to use the correct CVC.

## Insufficient balance 

When you're trying to pay an amount bigger than the one on your account, the payment won't go through to make sure you don’t fall into debt. In this situation, you should [top up your account](https://together.bunq.com/d/2933) or [link your card to another bunq account](https://together.bunq.com/d/233) to complete the payment.

## Card isn't active 

In order to be approved, card payments must be done with an active card. This means that if you've just ordered you card and didn't activate it yet or if you card is temporarily frozen, the payment won't go through. In these cases, you should first [activate your card](https://together.bunq.com/d/3985) before you try to pay again. 

## No 3DS2/Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) 

To increase the security of online card payments across the EEA region, new regulations were implemented on Jan 1st, 2021. This brought with it a new star - the 3DS2 security feature, otherwise known as Strong Customer Authentication (SCA). When you make an online payment, you can now easily authorize it through a push notification from the bunq app! However, in some cases, the merchant doesn't have things set up quite right on their end to meet these high security standards, and your payment might not go through. In this situation, it'd be best to use another payment method if possible. You can read more on this topic [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/41679-3ds2-and-soft-declines)

What's Dutch Switch Service and how do I enable it?

Hey bunqers  

Looking to easily switch over to bunq? You can do so via the fully mobile Dutch Switch Service within the app! As a collaboration between Dutch bank accounts, Dutch Switch Service allows all of your incoming payments and direct debits to be automatically forwarded to your bunq account. 

_**Note:** Switch Service isn't available for minors._

### How do I submit a Switch Service request?

All you have to do is [click here](https://www.bunq.com/tutorials/switch-service) and request a switch to bunq or follow the steps below and we will take care of the rest 

1. Go to **Profile** tab
2. Click on **⚙️** in the right corner on top
3. Tap on  **Dutch Switch Service** 
4. Go with the flow 

**You can also follow these steps**

1. Go to Home
2. Click on 
3. Type in "Switch Service"
4. Tap on  **Switch Service** 
5. Go with the flow 

---

## Processing the request

Once we receive and accept your request, we'll pass it along to your old bank. You'll then get a push notification informing you that:

- We've accepted your request. 
- Your old bank has 2 weeks to approve it.

**Note:** Approval process takes up to 14 business days for Personal accounts and 28 business days for Business accounts.

Keep in mind that you can always check the status of your request by simply checking the request's tab in the app. You'll be able to operate with your Switch Service account and export supporting documentation **after** the request has been approved. 

---

## Approving the request

Once your application has been fully processed by us and the corresponding bank, you'll get a push notification informing you that your Switch Service is active!

This means that (for 13 months): 

- All incoming payments made in your other bank account will be forwarded to your bunq account.
- All direct debits made in your other bank account will be forwarded to your bunq account. Once a new direct debit has been made with a company, we will automatically provide them with your bunq IBAN. Then the company will replace the IBAN on file so that all future payments will be directly sent to your bunq IBAN.


If you wish to cancel your Switch Service after it has already been accepted, please contact us via [Ask Privately](https://go.bunq.com/link/support). 

For any further information, you can also check out our Terms & Conditions [here](https://www.bunq.com/terms).

---

Together the awesome place to share your thoughts , ideas and experiences ❤️ with each other. After all, sharing is caring . But sometimes you will notice that comments or topics suddenly disappear. Let us explain why that happens. 

### Three reasons

There are basically three reasons why a post will get removed: 

1. To keep Together clear and neat!
To prevent Together from cluttering, we for instance will delete duplicate topics. Of course we first will give the user a proper answer or guide him/her to the appropriate topic. 

2. To keep a positive vibe!
We want Together to be a positive place. Of course you can also share your criticism as long as you do it in a respectful manner. So, for instance we won't tolerate any offensive language. Keep the bunq love spreading ❤️

3. Post contains personal information
Sometimes a post accidently contains personal information. In order to protect the user in question we will remove the post or only specific information within the post.

When something gets removed it will still be visible for the bunqer who wrote it and they also will see the reply of the moderator! 

## Locking a topic 
Another option a moderator has, is locking a topic. This will happen when a discussion seems to spin out of control. For instance, when a discussion goes back and forth all the time.
