Why do I have to send a proof of residence?

Hey bunqers  

As a bank, we have to comply with various laws designed to keep you and your money safe. In some cases, we're required to request an official document to confirm your current address.

## What documents are accepted as a proof of residence for Personal accounts?

✅ A residence permit issued less than 6 months ago.

✅ Utility bill for gas, water or electricity from less than 3 months ago

✅ Rental agreements less than 1 year old

✅ Proof of registration at a municipality or city hall, no longer than 1 year old

✅ Proof of enrolment in school/university for the current academic year

✅ Income Tax Return (ITR) 

✅ Proof of Dutch BSN ownership 

Please provide us with clear pictures or a PDF version of the complete, original document. Also screenshots are accepted as long as they're not cropped, blurry or covering important information from the document.

## What documents are accepted as a proof of residence for Business accounts?

✅ Utility bill for gas, water or electricity from less than 3 months ago

✅ Company Tax Return

✅ Rental agreements less than 1 year old (signed)

Please provide us with clear pictures or a PDF version of the complete, original document. Also screenshots are accepted as long as they're not cropped, blurry or covering important information from the document.

## Are there any other requirements?

We can only accept your proof of residence if the following information is on the document:

- Your name
- Your full address
- Date of issue
- Your signature and the landlord’s on a rental agreement
- Logo of the company on the utility bill

  Due to security reasons, we don't accept the following documents as a proof of residence:

- Bank statements
- Cell phone bills or any other bills
- Employment contracts
- Proof of property ownership
- Proof of temporary stay
- Address on an ID/Passport
- Payslips
- Short term permits from hostels/hotels
- Dutch RNI

## I’ve already sent a document. Why do I need to send it again?

- The document type isn't accepted as proof of residence  
- The document is too old
- The document is blurry
- It's a scanned copy 
- It isn't the full document: some important information, pages or a part of a page isn't shown

**What if I don’t have any of the documents listed above?**

We'll only ask you for a document if we're legally required to do so. In case you can’t provide us with such a document, we're not able to complete the account verification. We’ll gladly proceed with your verification as soon as you obtain one of these documents.

What's the difference between blocking a card temporarily and permanently?

Hey bunqers  

Lost your card or looking to get a new one? You have the option to **Block Temporarily** (deactivate) or **Block Permanently** your card.

### So what's the difference?

Blocking your card temporarily is a reversible action. If you deactivate your card, you can activate it once again in the future (such as if you find your card again).

Blocking your card permanently is an irreversible action. If you block your card permanently, you can no longer unblock it and you will need to order a new card.

If you want to activate your card, you can take a look at the topic [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/3985-how-do-i-activate-and-deactivate-my-card).

## How do I block my card temporarily?

To **temporarily block** your card, follow the steps below:

1. Go to Home tab and tap on Cards
2. Select a card
4. Tap on Settings
5. Tap on Block Card
6. Select  Block Temporarily
7. Done 


Keep in mind that due to security reasons, your card will be automatically blocked temporarily if there are multiple failed card transactions due to insufficient balance. 

You can re-activate your card by simply following the steps explained [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/50479) - once you do, you'll be able to either top-up the Bank Account linked to the card in question or link the card to a Bank Account with sufficient balance. If the same card keeps experiencing more failed transactions, it'll be permanently blocked.


## How do I block my card permanently?

To **block** your card, follow the steps below:

1. Go to Home tab and tap on Cards
2. Select a card
3. Tap on Settings
4. Tap on Block Card
5. Select  Block Permanently
6. Done 

---

## Can my card get automatically blocked?

Due to security reasons, your card will be automatically blocked temporarily if there are multiple failed card transactions due to insufficient balance. However, if the same card keeps experiencing more failed transactions, it'll be blocked permanently.

In case your card is only blocked temporarily, you can re-activate it by simply following the steps explained above - once you do, you'll be able to either top-up the Bank Account linked to the card in question or link the card to a Bank Account with sufficient balance.

SWIFT payments - what is this and how does it work?

Hey bunqers 

As you know, there are different types of bank transfers. One of them is called SWIFT and some of you use it pretty often. 

SWIFT payments are international transfers processed via the SWIFT international payment network - unlike regular SEPA payments. This network is one of the largest in the world. Most of these payments are from banks that aren’t within the SEPA (EEA) region. 

### How does SWIFT work? 

When you expect a SWIFT transfer, it may take up to 5 business days until you receive it. The longer waiting time for this type of payments is due to its specific way of processing - when your funds have to be transferred from a bank outside the EEA banking system, it takes longer for the information to be processed our way. You can learn more about the processing times [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/4295) 

Keep in mind that in order to receive SWIFT transfers, you need to fully verify your account. If you’re not verified, the payment will bounce back to the sending bank.

## What if my SWIFT payment hasn't arrived?

You can always start an in-app payment investigation for a SWIFT transfer which hasn’t arrived to or from your account. Just follow the simple steps [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/46954) ️

## How much do SWIFT payments cost?

#### Receiving SWIFT payments (up to €10.000)
- Easy Savings - free
- Easy Bank, Easy Money, and Easy Green - €5

#### Receiving SWIFT payments (between €10.000 and €100.000)
- Easy Savings - free
- Easy Bank, Easy Money, and Easy Green - €10

#### Receiving Swift payments (above €100.000)
- Easy Savings - free
- Easy Bank, Easy Money, and Easy Green - €25

## Wise 

When you’d like to send a SWIFT payment, you can use the services of our partner Wise 

Wise makes it faster and cheaper than traditional banks to send and receive payments. You can always rely on our app’s built-in integration with Wise to send money to foreign accounts. You can learn all about how it works [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/5149)!

I sent a transfer but the recipient hasn’t received it - what should I do?


Hey bunqers 

When you send a payment from your bunq account, we'll process it right away and send it to the receiving bank. It can then take a couple of days for the payment to arrive to the receiving bank account. 

If you have a suspicion that your transfer hasn’t arrived yet, here’s some things to consider:


### 1. Take into account the waiting time for your transfer’s processing

Since some banks work with different transferring channels, some transfers may take longer to process than others. Usually, bank transfers between banks in the SEPA Region take 1 to 2 business days to arrive to the recipient.

* Learn all about the processing times for outgoing transfers [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/50020-when-will-my-outgoing-payment-arrive) 

### 2. Check with the recipient

You can always contact the recipient to see if they’ve received the transfer or have received an indication that the transfer is on its way. 

You can also advise them to check their online banking app or export a bank statement to check if the payment has entered their account officially. 

### 3. The transfer hasn’t arrived even after the normal processing time is up, what next?

In such case, you can export a single transaction statement and provide it to the recipient as a proof that the transaction has left your account (and our system too). Then the recipient should request a payment investigation from their relevant bank and provide the same statement to them for further reference. 

If the receiving bank requests more information regarding the missing transfer, which cannot be found in the app, be sure to contact our [Support Team](https://together.bunq.com/d/32181-how-do-i-contact-support) and ask them for further assistance 

Why am I not receiving Cashback?

Hey bunqers 

You’ve used your Credit Mastercard at a restaurant, bar or for your public transport ticket and didn’t receive Cashback? There can be a couple of reasons behind this issue. For your ease, we’ve listed all of them in this topic!

### Check your Payday settings

If your Payday toggle is disabled, you won’t receive Cashback. This toggle is automatically enabled, but it’s worth checking it. The sub-account you’re going to receive your Payday on is your billing account. Further information about how you can enable this feature can be found [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/57060)

### Merchant’s Category Code isn’t eligible 

Cashback is earned on eligible payments, determined by the Merchant Category Code assigned by Mastercard. If the merchant has been assigned with a different Merchant Category Code that falls outside of [this list](https://together.bunq.com/d/57721), your payment won’t be eligible for Cashback.

### You’ve reached your limit

There’s a limit of €500 Cashback you can earn per year. After this limit has been reached, you won’t receive Cashback even if the card payment is an eligible one. 

### The payment wasn’t settled or it was refunded

Cashback is earned only on fully settled payments. If the payment still wasn’t claimed by the merchant, the Cashback feature won’t be triggered. 

Refunded payments also won’t receive Cashback.

How can I pay direct debits with bunq?

Hey bunqers 

Accept, decline and manage all of your direct debits with just a few clicks! Sounds cool, right? You can now manage all of your direct debits with bunq faster and easier than ever, check out more info on how you can do this below.

### What are SEPA Business to Business (B2B) Direct Debits and how do I accept them?

Normally, accepting a business to business direct debit requires you to send a signed form to your bank and, after acceptance, it can't be easily changed. We decided to do this differently- when another company sends a mandate form you can simply write down your bunq IBAN and send it back to them, no need to send us a copy! 

When the company then gives the form to their bank, they'll send the first direct debit. You'll see this as an event in the app, which you can accept or decline. It's that easy! 

Upon accepting the mandate you’ll accept all future direct debits from that party and the limit is automatically set based on the original amount. You can always change the limit of both the mandate and your bank account at any time.

---

## Did you receive a direct debit on your bunq bank account? 

- **Personal direct debits:** *You have five days* to accept or decline before it expires and is automatically declined. 

- **Business direct debits (B2B):** *you have 1 day (24 hours)* to accept or decline before it expires and is automatically accepted or declined based on your settings. 

- You're always able to select another sub-account, **for both** paying directly or upcoming recurring direct debits.

Find out how to pay Direct Debits and learn how to accept all future Direct Debits in the steps below:

1. Home
2. Tap on Events
3. Select the awaiting event
4. You can choose between Always accepting this Direct debit or to Accept only this direct debit
5. Enter your security code
6. Done  

----
## What to do if a direct debit got accidentally declined?


 In this case, you can **contact the debiting company** and transfer the amount you owe manually.

---

## How to manage my Direct Debits?

You can easily manage your direct debits with the following steps:

1. **Open** the bunq app
2. Tap on your **Sub-account**
3. Tap on **Settings** in the top right corner
4. Choose **Auto Accepted payments**
5. Choose Direct Debits
6. Choose the preferred direct debit
7. You can change the limit or delete the merchant from this list

**Please note that only the owner of the accepted direct debit can change the limit**

---

## How do I set it up with the company that offers the service?

If a company makes use of B2B Direct Debits, they'll send you a form to fill out. Normally you'll send this form back to the company and a copy to us (the debiting bank). With bunq you don't do the 2nd part and only return the form to the company (Creditor). The company will inform their bank to submit the debit request and you'll get a push notification in the bunq app and have 1 day to accept the mandate.

## How do I set it up in the app?

No need to set anything up, just wait for the 1st Direct Debit request to appear on your timeline and accept the request. You have 1 day to accept the request.

### What if I don't have enough funds for an accepted Direct Debit?

In this case, the Direct Debit will not be accepted yet and you will instead get a Request for it. You then have 5 days to accept the Request and pay the Direct Debit. If you don't accept the request within the 5 days, the Direct Debit will automatically be declined and it will not be paid.

Follow the steps below to learn how to do this:

1. Go to  Home
2. Tap on Events
3. Tap on the awaiting event
4. Try to Accept it > Error 
5. Select Top up balance
6. Choose your Top-up method
7. Top up you account and you are all set ✅

## Who can use this feature?

Every Easy Bank, Easy Money and Easy Green user.

## Can I refund a B2B SDD?

No, B2B Direct Debits are non-refundable. Make sure that the mandate reference and creditor ID correspond with the documents you signed.

## Does B2B SDD conflict with my daily limits?

We set the limit to the amount of the 1st debit request and you can adjust this limit. If any of your limits are bridged, you'll have the opportunity to approve the debit request again, updating the limit for future requests.

## Can I go below 0 through a B2B SDD?

No, if you don't have sufficient funds on your account the B2B Direct Debit not go through and we give you a day to top up and accept the debit.

## Does this mean I can issue SDDs and send them to consumers?

No. That's still on the wishlist and can be done by a PSP in the meantime, for instance Buckaroo/Mollie

## I've already approved the SDD, but the app always tells me to authorize each payment. Why is this happening?

Direct Debits are whitelisted (automatically approved) by a combination of IBAN and the MandateID. If the same company sends a user a new Direct debit from the same IBAN, but the MandateID is different, the payment will need to be accepted manually instead of it happening automatically.

## I can't select between all of my Bank Accounts to pay the SDD from?

You can only pay or accept the SDD with Bank Accounts from the same account you've received the SDD on.

## Can I pay the SDD with my Savings Account?

No, you can’t make regular day-to-day payments with your Savings Account, which also includes the paying of SDD payments.

I received a garnishment on my French account 

Hey bunqers 

### What's a garnishment?

If you have an outstanding debt to an individual, institution, or entity (also known as a creditor), they may obtain a court order to recover the money you owe. This process is called garnishment. According to French law, a garnishment allows the garnishor (the party that’s owed money) to legally force the garnishee (the debtor) to fulfill their financial obligations to the relevant creditor.

## What happens if your French account received a garnishment?

#### Step 1. We’ll let you know

When we’re contacted by a creditor (a bailiff, an institution, a Creditor or acreditor’s representative) and receive the administrative enforceable documents from them, we put the bank account in question under garnishment by temporarily freezing your monetary account(s)  and inform you right away in the app.

To check your received messages from bunq, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to Profile
2. Click on “See More” under Activity
3. Check out the messages sent there

#### Step 2. Seizure

While we’re processing the garnishment, we temporarily freeze your monetary account(s). We will transfer funds from your account into a special bunq intermediary account where they will be reserved for the creditor. We can only seize funds that are above the free-feet amount (unseizable funds by law) and up to the amount of your garnishment. 

In case there isn’t enough money to cover the debt, we will need to keep your monetary account(s) frozen until enough funds are available to settle the garnishment.

In any case we will proceed with the transfer of the seized funds to the bailiff (either directly from your account or from the intermediary account - depending on the case) 

Usually we wait for a document from the bailiff to transfer the seized amount from our internal account (where your seized funds are stored) to the bailiff's account.

#### Step 3. Unfreezing your Bank Accounts

When the procedure above is completed, or we receive an explicit request from the creditor, we'll unfreeze your monetary account(s). Then you can use your bunq account as usual.

If the debt is decreased or you have settled it by means other than bunq, we must receive an official written statement from the creditor where it’s stated that the proceedings were completed and bunq is at liberty to release the monetary accounts or return any seized funds.

## When will my account be unblocked?

This depends on the instructions of the bailiff. To have your account unblocked, please contact the bailiff or agree the amounts (enough to fulfill the debt) to be paid and request a release of the seizure provided by the creditor.

## Is there an administration fee for a garnishment?

By French law, bunq is required to process every garnishment. Since this is fully regulated by the French law, we process garnishment(s) free of charge.

## I have another question about a garnishment placed on my account. Who do I contact?

We've shared the available details about the garnishment, including the file number and the creditor's name, in the garnishment announcement. For more specific advice and assistance, it would be best to reach out to the bailiff directly. They'll be able to provide you with more detailed information.

## When will my garnishment finish?

As soon as a judge rules on the garnishment, we’ll receive the verdict and when we have the needed transfer order, we’ll immediately process all needed payments.

## How can I appeal?

As a third-party, we don't handle objections or other requests related to the garnishment. These matters are managed by the institution or the bailiff who placed the garnishment. If you have any further questions, it’ll be best to contact the bailiff about them.

## What if I have more than one garnishment?

When you have multiple garnishments, your account will be blocked until all of the garnishment proceedings are completed.

Hey bunqers  

You or someone just sent a transfer to your closed bunq account? Don’t worry - your funds aren’t lost! Learn what happens and what can you do in such a case below:

### How does it work?

Whenever you send funds to an inactive Bank Account in bunq, our system won’t accept the transfer and instead, the transfer will be sent back to the sender’s bank account. Once reversed, the funds can be sent to another active account   

## When will my funds bounce back?

It’s possible that the reversal may take 1-2 business days for SEPA transfers and up to 7 business days for SWIFT. Learn more about the estimated payment arrival time [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/4295) 

## My transfer didn’t come back, what’s next?

In such case, make sure to contact the bank from which you sent the transfer and ask for a further investigation and reversal of the transfer in question. Sometimes the funds might get stuck while bouncing back due to technical error on the cooperating bank’s side. 

## I sent a payment to a bunq Bank Account when it was closed, but now I reactivated it. Will the funds still arrive? 

The answer here in most cases is no. When you make the transfer and it gets processed by the cooperating bank, our system automatically declines the payment at the moment of processing. 

This means that even if the Bank Account is reactivated right after the transfer, the possibility of receiving the funds is little to none.

In most passports you'll find the document reference number under the line mentioning "Document number". This section is usually placed on the top right corner of the document.

Different issuing countries have a different way to show the document number on Identity Cards.  As it happens for passports, most of the Identity Cards (like the French, the Belgian, the Austrian, the Lithuanians or the Dutch ones) show a section called "Document number". 

Other Identity Cards, like the Polish or the German ones, don't have this section mentioned, but report the number in a specific section of the card (German Identity cards have it on the top right corner, while Polish ones are on the back, top right corner of the card).  For some countries, like Spain, the document number matches the personal number (DNI). 

## Driver's license

We accept driving licenses from all EU (European Union) countries. On this document, the number is always placed on the front part of the document under the section n. 5 as well as on the back of the document under the BSN.  

## Residence Permit

We accept Residence Permits issued in all EEA (European Economic Area) countries. You'll be able to find the document number on the top right corner of the front of the document.

I was declared as Bankrupt/Insolvent in Germany or the Netherlands

Hey bunqers 

### What is bankruptcy/ insolvency?

Bankruptcy is a legal process where an individual or entity declares an inability to repay outstanding debts. Once declared bankrupt/insolvent a curator/insolvency administrator is always appointed by the relevant court to manage your funds. 

If this happens to you in the Netherlands or Germany, bunq is legally obliged to block all liable monetary accounts which belong to the natural person and/or all liable company/ies.

## What’s the difference?

#### In Germany  

At this point you’re no longer authorized to make use of your bank balances. Your insolvency administrator will be the one handling all your funds until the legal proceedings are concluded or bunq is provided with a written document from the insolvency administrator or the relevant court for the release of the monetary accounts covered by the insolvency.

#### In the Netherlands  

At this point you’re no longer authorized to make use of your bank balances;our curator will be the one handling all your funds until a court order is announced in the Dutch public bankruptcy register or provided to us by the curator.

## What’s next?

#### Step 1: We’ll let you know

We can be made aware of your bankruptcy or insolvency case if:
- we’re contacted by a curatortor an insolvency administrator
- information is published in the [bankruptcy registry](https://www.rechtspraak.nl/Onderwerpen/Schulden/Faillissement) 

 Once bunq receives all the necessary documentation we will block all available monetary accounts in your name (including unlimited liable company account(s) under your name)

Your account(s) will have to remain blocked until we receive a request to unblock one or all available monetary accounts by the court-appointed curator or insolvency administrator. We’ll immediately inform you about this update via an in-app message. To check your received messages from bunq, you can follow these simple steps:

1. Go to Profile
2. Click on “See More” under Activity
3. Check out the messages sent there
4. The time your account will remain blocked solely depends on the decisions of your curator/insolvency administrator.

#### Step 2: Seizure

Throughout this whole process, we comply with a variety of requests which your  curator or insolvency administrator may have, keeping in mind the limitations of the applicable law.

When the curator or insolvency administrator requests transfer of all available funds in your liable Bank Accounts, we’ll transfer the amounts to the dedicated bank account created for the purpose of resolving your bankruptcy or insolvency case.

#### Step 3: Unlocking your Bank Accounts

There are two ways to get your account unblocked and released from bankruptcy or insolvency.
- A court order from the same court that initially declared the bankruptcy or insolvency now declares that the proceedings have ended and the account(s) can be reactivated. 
- Your curator or insolvency administrator can contact us with a request to reactivate your account(s) by providing us with the court order.


## Can the curator/insolvency administrator request termination of my bunq bank account?

Yes, the curator/insolvency administrator has the legal right to request the permanent termination of your bank account with all available monetary accounts in it, which is a request we’re obliged to comply with.

## When will my account be unblocked?

As a third-party, our access to information is limited and is solely based on what is provided by the curator. Therefore, the handling of this matter is subject to the instructions given by the curator.

## When will my bankruptcy (in the Netherlands) or insolvency (in Germany) end?

As soon as a judge rules on the release of a particular monetary account or termination of your whole bankruptcy procedure. When that happens, we must receive the written verdict from said curator/insolvency administrator.

## How can I appeal?

We've shared the available details about the bankruptcy/ insolvency. For more specific advice and assistance, it would be best to contact your curator/insolvency administrator. They'll be able to provide you with more detailed information.

### Why do we do this?

The sanctions mentioned in this article are synchronized as per:

- Council Regulation (EU) 2022/328, Article 5b and 5f for Russian nationals
- Council Regulation (EU) 2022/398 Article 1u and 1z for Belarussian nationals 

If you believe that any of the sanctions are applied incorrectly, you can always contact us directly through the [Support center](https://together.bunq.com/d/32181) for further assistance. 

## Account balance limitations 

Your total account balance is limited to €100,000 due to sanction-related regulations for non-EU residents. Keep in mind that the limit is applicable to all of your sub-accounts and Savings Accounts (including Joint). This means that you can only deposit a total of up to €100,000 across all of your accounts.


## Closing your bunq Account

In case you're not following bunq’s Terms & Conditions (where all the sanction-related regulations are listed), we have the right to suspend and close your bunq account. You can learn more about this [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/26054)

## Exemption from sanctions 

You’re exempt from the sanctions if you have a temporary or permanent residence permit that is valid in the European Union, Norway, Iceland, Liechtenstein or Switzerland. A valid passport or identity card issued in any of the aforementioned areas is also acceptable. 

If any of the above sanctions are applied to your account but you believe this is incorrect, please reach out to us via [Support](https://together.bunq.com/d/32181) so that we can assist you further. We aim to resolve such cases and remove restrictions from your account as soon as possible.

## ID verification

As a Belarusian or Russian national, your identity verification request will be reviewed individually. Keep in mind that, in some cases, your ID verification may take longer due to regulations and the legal document requirements.

* Learn more about the accepted identity documents [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/3355)

## International funds transfer

We have adopted a measure concerning SWIFT transfers to prevent large-amount transfers from Russia and Belarus to Europe. That’s why we actively monitor international transfers to your account. This can mean that some transactions to your account are stopped. We review these transactions on hold as soon as possible, usually within 48 hours, and may ask for some additional information regarding your transfer. Learn more about this [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/48483)

On occasion, the review can take up to 7 days. We will make sure to keep you in the loop every step of the way!

Also, keep in mind that in March 2022, a number of Russian and Belarusian banks were excluded from the SWIFT international payment system. Please see the list of excluded sanctioned banks at the bottom of this page.

CurrencyCloud, our partners for Local Currencies, won’t process transfers to and from Russia and Belarus until further notice. This means that your Local Currencies accounts can’t send or receive transfers from Russia and Belarus from 9th of March, 2022, 12:00 CET onwards. 

### Wise service regulations 

Wise informed their customers and partners that from the 1st of March, 2022, they’ve deactivated their services for Russia and Belarus in RUB currency. This means that you can't send or receive transfers from Russia using Wise. 

### Mastercard service suspension

In an [official statement](https://www.mastercard.com/news/press/2022/march/mastercard-statement-on-suspension-of-russian-operations/) on their official website, Mastercard announced the suspension of all of their services in Russia. This means that your Mastercard won’t operate when used at Russian ATM machines or merchants.

### Why do we restrict accounts?

As a bank, we're legally required to protect our users’ accounts and the integrity of our banking system. To make sure everything stays safe, we pay close attention to how our customers use their accounts. This helps us identify anything suspicious, and flag any activity that could present a problem. 

Whenever we recognize suspicious activity that goes against our [Terms and Conditions](https://www.bunq.com/terms), we take immediate action. This helps keep your account safe, and protects your data. 

Please be assured that we’ll never intentionally freeze or close an account although the laws prevent us from sharing additional details. Thank you for your understanding 

## What happens when my account is restricted?

Sometimes bunq may temporarily restrict your bunq account(s). That could mean either a complete restriction for all the incoming and outgoing payments or a partial restriction for the outgoing payments only. 

You'll always receive a notification for such blocking of your account(s).

## Does this mean my account with bunq will be terminated?

The short answer is no. Each case is reviewed by our dedicated team and processed in line with our policies and legal requirements. We won’t terminate your account without further notification. However there’s certain information that we’re not legally allowed to share with you.

## What happens with my money once my bunq account is terminated?

In case we’ve determined that your bunq account usage differs substantially from what’s considered a regular day-to-day banking behavior, we may take actions on your account closure and you won’t be able to receive any incoming payments afterwards. * 2nd case scenario

Any remaining funds in your account(s) will be held after closure for an initial period of 4 months in order to cover any outstanding payments or fees, pre-approved payments, or rightful claims of third parties.

How we’d handle a data breach 

Hey bunqers 

As bunq, we comply with banking regulations in order for us to secure your personal data. That’s why we made sure to come up with an internal process, which ensures that in case of data breach all regulations are met and you’re informed right away. 

### What's a data breach?

A data breach is a security incident where personal data is compromised, leading to a breach in confidentiality, availability, or integrity. If such a breach occurs and it has high risk for our users, we would communicate the matter to the Dutch Supervisory Authority no later than 72 hours after becoming aware of the breach. 

The following situations constitute a Personal Data Breach:

- Confidentiality breach - where there is an unauthorized or accidental disclosure of, or access to, personal data

- Availability breach - where there is an accidental or unauthorized loss of access to, or destruction of, personal data

- Integrity breach - where there is an unauthorized or accidental alteration of personal data

## What happens in such a case? 

1. If such breach occurs, our employees are required to inform the Data Protection Officer as soon as possible.

2. The Data Protection Officer determines if the Personal Data Breach is still ongoing and ensures that appropriate steps are taken immediately to contain and minimize the impact of the Personal Data Breach. 

3. The Data Protection Officer will determine if a particular Personal Data Breach should be notified to the Dutch Data Protection Authority. If necessary the Personal Data Breach will be notified to the Dutch Data Protection Authority as soon as possible but no later than 72 hours using the online form.

## Is my data protected? 

Absolutely! In bunq we always make sure your data is secure - all of your personal data is encrypted and secured with an extremely strong authorization gate.

To deposit cash using Barzahlen, follow the steps mentioned below:

2. Click on  Add
3. Add Money
4. Tap on Cash Deposit and select the desired amount
5. A barcode will then be generated and a map with Barzahlen supported stores will be seen
6. Go to the desired store and show the barcode

To withdrawal funds using Barzahlen, follow these steps:

1. Go to  Home 
2. Tap on the desired Bank Account
3. Tap "More"
4. Select "Withdrawal & Deposit"
5. A screen will pop up asking you if you want to withdrawal or deposit funds. Select "Withdrawal"
6. Type in the desired sum
6. A barcode will then be generated and a map with Barzahlen supported stores will be seen
7. Go to the desired store and show the barcode

**Note:** The barcode for both deposits and withdrawals is valid for 1 hour so make sure to check the store’s working hours before generating the barcode. Further more, you have 4 free withdrawals per month. After this, you'll be charged €0.99 per withdrawal.

## Who can use Barzahlen/Viacash?

bunq Personal and Business users [with Easy Bank, Easy Money, Easy Green plans] living in  Germany or  Austria or bunq users with the previously mentioned plans who travel to the available countries.

## Can I use this service if I'm traveling to Germany or Austria?

Yes! As long as you've location services enabled in your app, the Withdraw and Deposit button will be shown when you're in a supported country. .

## What are the limits?

- **Deposits**: The *minimum is €50* and the *max is €999,99* per 24h period. The first €100 deposited each (billing) month is free, then there’s a **2,5%** fee on the total amount above that. You'll be charged this in your monthly invoice.

- **Withdrawals**: The *minimum is €1* and the *maximum is €200* per calendar day. 

*All limits apply per user not per bank account. These limits don't have an influence on the card (withdraw) limits. You can check your withdrawal limits [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/6635)*

*Barzahlen/viacash withdrawals will be counted towards the 6 free withdrawals per month for Easy Money and Easy Green users.*


## Why is Barzahlen/Viacash not available in other countries?

To give users in countries that rely on cash an easier way to make deposits, we partnered with Barzahlen/viacash Payment Solutions. They only provide service in  Germany and  Austria at this time, but we'll be sure to update you if this ever changes. 

Users residing in **Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Republic of Cyprus, Czech Republic, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, The Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain and Sweden** can top up using cash via PaysafeCash. Withdrawal/deposit can't be canceled right now due to a limitation on Barzahlen's side, so that they've the time to verify if the withdrawal or deposit actually happened or not before allowing it to be canceled. As soon as the retailer confirms the deposit, it should be straight in your account.

How to recognize fraud and stay safe?




Hey bunqers 

As you know, bunq takes the security of your personal information very seriously  We’ve already shared some tips on how to keep you and your money safe here, but we thought it might help to provide some more tips to to help you recognize fraud.

**Important Note:** bunq would never contact you via phone or ask for your credentials, magic links or any personal information (phone number, email, security code, card number, IBAN, etc.) outside the bunq app.

### What to do if you became a victim of fraud or you are suspecting fraud?

- Check your bank account frequently, and always read your bankmail swiftly after receiving it. If you've been a victim of fraud, contact your bank immediately.
- If you suspect fraud, please give а notice to your bank about your suspicions.
- If you suspect a bunq user to be involved with fraud or scams, you can report it through the form [here](https://www.bunq.com/report/fraud).
- Fill out [this form](https://www.bunq.com/report) to report your incident and help us to fight fraud!
- If you have a card payment on your bunq account that you don’t recognize or it was a result of fraud, you can easily follow the steps in-app explained [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/23367).

## Phishing

Phishing is an attempt by fraudsters to obtain your personal information, such as passwords or security details. The fraudsters often disguise themselves as a trustworthy party by using fake websites that look just like legitimate websites. The general lay-out as well as the link are often almost exactly the same. These websites are very good at making you believe they are sending a genuine email from (for example) your bank or an online payment processor, when in fact it is fake.

If you receive an email or other messages that resemble bunq’s normal messages, in which you are asked to follow a link and log in, or share your login codes or other security information, **please do not follow these instructions.**

bunq will never ask for your login codes or security features either by phone (we don’t use phone calls as a way of communication), via e-mail, text message, WhatsApp or any form of social media.

If you don’t trust a website or are unsure, you can always use an external tool to double-check. Here’s a tip: If the website seems to be registered recently, this may be an indication that the website is fraudulent. For more information, check out the following topics we prepared for you for [Phishing](https://together.bunq.com/d/54498) and [Spoofing](https://together.bunq.com/d/45398).

## Old-fashioned phishing
This happens when you are entering your PIN in an ATM or at a payment station. Please make sure that no one is watching you and that you always cover your PIN while you are entering it. Afterward, store your passcode safely.

## WhatsApp fraud (Impersonation Scam)

WhatsApp fraud is a form of fraud where someone pretends to be someone you know, and asks you to help them out with the payment of a bill through a Whatsapp message. Usually, the following characteristics apply:

- The “person you know” has a new number and contacts you through Whatsapp; for example, they got their phone lost/stolen, changed their number, etc. but it will always be a situation of urgency
- They ask you to help them out by paying a bill for them or just some other emergency reason for financial help;
- Usually, they are in a rush, the bill needs to be paid quickly;
- They cannot, or do not want to, communicate with you through any other means than Whatsapp.

If anyone asks you to transfer money, or to pay an existing bill for them, please always contact this person through other means of communication outside of Whatsapp. When you cannot reach this person, do not transfer any money. Scammers usually try to ‘play’ with your emotions and would pretend to be not only just acquaintances but also close family members.

How can you help stop this kind of fraud? If a link was provided by the scammer make sure to report the IBAN or the link to the police and the bank of the fraudster.

## Fake payment requests

If you receive a payment request, always make sure to check the validity of the web page the link leads you to. Often fraudsters will use fake internet pages which look very similar to the normal payment environment of a bank, but the website is in fact a fake one. The information you enter in this payment request is directly visible to the fraudsters and might be used to access your bank account.

**Never enter your information if you do not trust the payment link or the person that is sending you the payment request.**

## Marketplace fraud

There are many times where you will find the item you were looking for on second hand websites. This is great! Second hand items are cheaper and reusing products contributes to a greener world. Unfortunately, sometimes the person who promises to send you the product doesn’t deliver after you have paid.

How do you recognize these kinds of fraudsters? First, we’d like to emphasise that if something sounds too good to be true, it’s usually because it isn’t true. Always check the market value of the product you want to purchase. If the price of the offered product is too low, this can be a sign that there’s a fraudster at work.

## Investment fraud (Boiler room)

Boiler room fraud is a scam where pushy salespeople trick people into investing in fake or risky companies. They often lie or overstate facts to make the investment look more appealing, risk-free and safe. Sometimes, they even make fake propaganda on social media platforms before calling the victim. After people invest, their money is usually taken away, and they hardly ever get the profits they were promised. To keep yourself safe, be careful with unexpected investment offers, do detailed research, and ask financial experts for advice before investing.

## Don’t become a money mule!

If anyone reaches out to you to ask you for access to your bank account or to transfer some money through your bank account, never comply with this request, no matter how promising it sounds!

Here's an example: Someone reaches out to you through social media or friends and promises you an amount of money. They promise you this money if you transfer some funds for them, or if they can use your bank account for a few days. They will tell you there is no risk involved, and that it is really easy money.

It is highly likely that your bank account will be used for criminal activity, for which you will be held (criminally) liable. Consequences of this may be that you will not be able to open bank accounts, get a mortgage or obtain credit and that criminal proceedings may follow.

Again, please realize that if something sounds too good to be true, this usually is because it is not true.

For more information on money mules, please check out [this website](https://www.politie.nl/informatie/money-mules-en-de-gevolgen-als-je-wordt-gepakt.html) by the Dutch police.

If you receive a bunq.me payment link and you suspect it's fraud, please use the report button to report the page to our compliance team. Our team will immediately take action against the account.

Can I receive a SWIFT payment?



Hey bunqers  

Your bunq account processes SWIFT payments without any issues - all Bank Accounts ([Local Currency](https://together.bunq.com/d/45414-local-currencies/9) and [Local IBANs](https://together.bunq.com/d/45253)) can receive SWIFT payments in their relevant currency. 

### How long does it take to arrive?

Normally SWIFT payments are received in 2-3 working days, but they can **take up to a week** to arrive. SWIFT payments are more complex and time-consuming to process, so we apply a processing fee. You can find the fee in our [pricing list](http://bunq.com/pricing-sheet)

* Want to learn more about the arrival time of your transaction? Click [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/4295)! 

## What is SWIFT?

SWIFT payments are international transfers processed via the SWIFT international payment network unlike regular SEPA payments. This network is one of the largest in the world.  Most of these payments are coming from banks that are not within the [SEPA region](https://www.ecb.europa.eu/paym/integration/retail/sepa/html/index.en.html). 

If you have an [e-money account](https://together.bunq.com/d/30060-what-is-an-e-money-account-and-how-do-i-use-it), we will not be able to process your incoming SWIFT payment, you are required [to fully verify your account](https://together.bunq.com/d/33613-how-long-does-it-take-to-verify-my-paperwork) before your SWIFT payment arrives. If not, it will be returned to the sending bank.

---

## What if my SWIFT payment hasn't arrived?

If your SWIFT payment has not arrived, we ask that you reach out the sender or sending bank. Please ask them to investigate and provide you with the reference for the payment. You can then [reach out to our Support team](https://together.bunq.com/d/32181-how-do-i-contact-support) with the gathered information and we will do a target search on our end.

---
## Wise

When you would like to send and receive payments in different currencies, we recommend using Wise as an intermediary bank. Wise makes it faster and cheaper than traditional banks to send and receive payments in 39 different currencies!
You can also rely on our app’s [built-in integration](https://together.bunq.com/d/5149-what-is-transferwise/2) with Wise to send money to foreign accounts! 

Does bunq support instant payments?

Hey bunqers  

We love helping you save time and manage your money without any hassle ✨ That’s why we’ve made Instant Payments even better for you!  

###  Send money in real time
As of today, we’ve made major improvements to our coverage for real-time payments. Thanks to our extended coverage, it’s even easier to freely send and receive money from any participating Dutch or European bank! All banks fully connected to either RT1 or TIPS are supported.

**Note:** As of November 19, 2023, the upper limit for outgoing instant payments will be raised to €100,000.

## Which banks can I make instant payments to and from?
bunq is part of 2 pan-European instant payments systems: **_TIPS_** and **_RT1_**. To see if your bank is part of them too, check out the lists of participating banks: 

- [TIPS](https://www.ecb.europa.eu/paym/target/tips/facts/html/index.en.html) (Important - Knab is part of TIPS, however, currently they have only enabled the receiving of instant payments)
- [RT1](https://www.ebaclearing.eu/services/rt1/participants/)

----
We’re proud to be the first challenger bank that enables instant payments across Europe  Simply experience this amazing time saver with your next [payment!](https://together.bunq.com/d/115)
______      

## Why is this payment not sent as Instant Payment? 

There can be a multitude of causes:

- The 2 banks are on 2 different systems;
- One of the banks blocks instant payments from or to another for fraud reasons;
- The receiving bank has specific compliance requirements in place, requiring us to transfer a payment as regular SEPA Credit Transfer (SCT), which takes more time. This is the case for Boursorama Bank [BIC: BOUSFRPPXXX] and Openbank [BIC: OPENESMMXXX].

## Are Instant Payments still possible during the weekend?

Have to make a quick payment over the weekend? Not a problem because Instant Payments are possible between supporting banks, 365 days a year 

- Instant Transfers are processed 24/7 and 365 days of the year.
- Instant Transfers are included with all our plans (except for [Easy Savings](https://together.bunq.com/d/48095)) ; at no additional costs

What is the European Central Bank (ECB)?

[center][/center]

Hey bunqers  

The ECB, or European Central Bank, is the main repository used by individual banks in Europe. In other words, it serves as the central bank for all EU countries that have adopted the euro!

### What's European Central Bank's goal? 

The main goal of the ECB is to ensure proper circulation of funds so that the economy keeps on running smoothly. They serve as the man behind the curtain to help maintain stability of the euro.

As the ECB is the “bank of banks”, they never invest in anything. They don’t have a need to make investments as the ability to print and regulate money is in their own hands. By storing your money with them, you can ensure that it is not being used for shady practices.

If you want to learn more about ECB and what they do, check out [this link](https://www.ecb.europa.eu/ecb/html/index.en.html) for more info!

### Take into account the normal waiting time for a refund
In case the merchant is processing your refund manually (meaning - you didn’t request it through the app yourself), every kind of refund may take a different amount of time to be processed. This is due to the multiple systems merchants may use and also the ways they process refunds may take more technical time.

You can check with the merchant on the sending date of the refund and calculate what’s the latest date in which your funds should arrive.

## The processing time has passed and the refund is still not with me, what now?

Contact the merchant again and ask for the status of your refund and check if there isn’t an error on their end. Best way to communicate with them here is via written form (chat/email), so that you can provide all needed information easily, and in turn receive proof of communication for later stages if needed.

When contacting them for the first time, you can provide them with a [bank statement](https://together.bunq.com/d/3207-how-do-i-export-a-bank-statement) proving that the refund isn’t in your account yet. Once the merchant checks in their system and with their bank, they’ll be able to locate the refund and give you further info.

* Pro tip: In case the merchant has **reversed** the payment (meaning they just return your transfer back to you), then it’s possible that the refund got stuck with the other bank. In such case, to have the refund processed, simply request an [in-app refund](https://together.bunq.com/d/47826-how-to-request-an-in-app-refund) and the funds should arrive in your account. If this doesn’t help, keep on reading 

## The merchant claims that the refund is in bunq’s system, what’s next? 

In this case you can either: 

- Request in-app payment investigation and provide all the info given to you from the merchant 
- Request a refund through the app in order for us to investigate further on our side

In both cases, our relevant department will take a further look at the case, liaise with all relevant parties and keep you in the loop with the status of your refund. Once your refund is back with you, you’ll be notified right away.

I received a garnishment on my Dutch account 

Hey bunqers 

### What's a garnishment?

If you have an outstanding debt to an individual, institution, or entity (also known as a creditor), they may obtain a court order to recover the money you owe. This process is called garnishment. The creditor or a bailiff acting on their behalf can use garnishment to retrieve the outstanding costs. Remember, we're here to help you navigate through this process if it happens.

## Who can place a garnishment on my account?

Each institution with the relevant court order in their favor can place a garnishment on your account. Some of the most common ones are the Tax Authority, the Unemployment Benefit Agency, and the Central Judicial Collection Agency.

A bailiff can also place a garnishment on your account. Court order in favor of the creditor is needed so they can reach out to the bailiff. This court order is delivered to bunq by the bailiff. A judge can rule that the money on your account must be used to pay off your debt. bunq is obliged to comply with their request through a garnishment process. Garnishments are lifted by the bailiff only, not by bunq.

## What happens if your Dutch account received a garnishment?

#### Step 1. Seizure

First, we must have received a garnishment request by the institution or the bailiff accompanied with the court order. While we’re processing the garnishment, we temporarily freeze your monetary account(s). That’s only until we transfer the funds into a special bunq intermediary account where they will be reserved for the bailiff. Once this is done, we will reactivate your monetary account(s) and you can use your bunq account as usual. We will not seize any funds that came in the account(s) after that.   

We transfer all your funds to this internal account unless the garnishment order states that there is a garnishment free feet. A garnishment free feet is the unseizable amount which is defined by law as the minimum necessary funds for living and it’s based on your family composition: 

- €1.661,40 for a single person,
- €1.779,52 for a single parent, 
- €2.199,34 for a married couple without children, 
-  €2.317,54 for a married couple with children.

#### Step 2. Statement

Once we seize the funds to the intermediary account, we inform the institution or the bailiff about the amount(s) available. We do that by providing them with a third-party statement which includes this information. 

#### Step 3. Transfer

Based on the third-party statement, the institution or the bailiff will send us a letter with instructions whether and what amount of funds should be transferred to them.

## Is there an administration fee for a garnishment? 

By Dutch law, bunq is required to process every garnishment. For each garnishment we process, an administrative fee of  €80 is applied. 

## Can a bailiff ask for information about my bank account prior to a garnishment?

Before a bailiff places a garnishment on your bank account, the bailiff is allowed to ask whether you have a bunq account. This is by law, according to article 475aa Rv, we as a bank are required to answer this question.

## I have another question about a garnishment placed on my account. Who do I contact? 

We've shared the available details about the garnishment, including the file number and the creditor's name, in the garnishment announcement. For more specific advice and assistance, it would be best to reach out to the bailiff directly. They'll be able to provide you with more detailed information.

## When will my garnishment be lifted?

The garnishment on your account will be lifted once we receive a court order stating that the garnishment proceedings have been finalized. 

## Why are the assets of my minor also frozen?

Your kid is a minor, therefore their funds are your responsibility and included in the garnishment

## How can I appeal?

As a third-party, we don't handle objections or other requests related to the garnishment. These matters are managed by the institution or the bailiff who placed the garnishment. If you have any further questions, it’ll be best to contact the bailiff about them.

## I paid the bailiff from another bank, what should I do?

We're able to act based on the instructions we receive from the bailiff. If your debt has been settled through another account, the bailiff should inform us about this update. To expedite the process, you might want to confirm with your bailiff that they've contacted us. Please note that we'll need some time to process this information.

What is Outgoing Switch Service?



Hey bunqers  

As soon as you have submitted a Switch Service Request with another bank, that bank will forward your request to us. We will then verify that everything is in order. If everything is good the request will be accepted. You will then receive a message from us containing the date on which the service will be activated.  

Your bunq account will remain active and will continue to function the same as before. After the activation date of the Switch Service you can expect the below things to happen.

## Incoming Payments
Payments made from other banks to your bunq IBAN 
- These payments will be automatically redirected to your other bank account and you will not see them in your bunq account. Payments made between bunq accounts (including connected aliases) for which you requested the Switch Service. 
- Each of these payments will show up in your overview twice. Once for the money coming into your bunq account, and  again for the money being redirected to your other bank account.  

----

## Outgoing payments
You can continue to make payments with your bunq account. These will not be affected by the Switch Service. 

---

## Direct Debits
All Direct Debits will be automatically forwarded to your other bank account.  Be advised: Some Direct Debits are submitted up to two weeks in advance. This means that they can still end up being paid with your bunq account up to two weeks after your Switch Service was activated.  

---

## My Account
Be advised: The Switch Service will only affect the IBAN you submitted while making the request. Payments and Direct Debits coming in on any of your other accounts will not be redirected to your other bank. 

---

## Using your bunq card on a switched account
You can continue to make card payments with the switched account and they will be processed as usual. You will not see any of these transactions on your other bank. 

---

## Topping up a switched account
If, for whatever reason, you want to top up the bunq account for which you initiated the Switch Service, please take note that you can only do so with the bank account on the other side of the service. Payments made from the account on the other side of the Switch Service will not be bounced back.

Anti-Fraud Guide: Money mules - Don’t become one!

Hey bunqers 

Your safety and that of your money are our top priorities, which is why we ask you to consider the risk of third parties who might misuse your identity and your account to cover up their crimes. Here’s how to keep safe from money muling.

### What is mulling?

Similarly to drug mules, banking mules are used as carriers for activities that are too risky for the fraudsters to engage in personally. This means that they’d rather use a bank account created in your name for money laundering. Unfortunately, this means the holder of the account would be liable for all of these illicit transactions.

A mule allows third parties to access and use their accounts and/or agrees to make transactions upon the instruction of third parties.

Please always remember that if what they’re doing was legitimate, these people would use their own accounts! As a type of money laundering, muling is illegal and persecuted by the authorities.

## How to avoid being misled into mulling?

We ask for your caution any time someone wants anything to do with your banking ️‍️. Here are 6 best practices for keeping yourself and your account safe from fraudsters:

- Never agree to grant ‘favors’ related to your banking to nice strangers or even people you know by allowing them to access your accounts or making transfers on behalf of them - neither in good will nor in exchange for payment. 
- Be extra careful with generous tempting offers for jobs, loans, bonuses that promise quick hefty gain, especially received from strangers and/or via social media!
- Never give your login credentials or personal information to anyone.
- Watch out for fake websites - carefully inspect the links you receive before clicking - if the format, spelling, and domain name don’t match the businesses web address it claims to be from, it’s likely a scam.
- If you’re unsure or suspect you might be targeted, contact us via our official channels [here](https://www.bunq.com/report)
- Never post your bank or card details online or on social media, not even in a group or group chat.

Please contact our Support team [here](https://www.bunq.com/contact) or via the bunq app if you feel your account or identity is at risk, or if you have any questions regarding your account.

Who can open a bunq Business account in the Netherlands 

Hey bunqers  

Your safety and well-being are our priority. We have an acceptance policy in place to abide by legal regulations and follow some of our own risk standards as a company.

After you complete the sign-up process in 5 minutes, we'll quickly review your application. We assess each application individually to make sure every company is held to the same standard and fulfils all requirements.

bunq [Easy Savings](https://together.bunq.com/d/48095), [Easy Bank](https://together.bunq.com/d/44002-easy-bank), [Easy Money](https://www.bunq.com/business) and [Easy Green](https://together.bunq.com/d/26307) let you save time, so you can focus on what's truly important: your business. Wondering if you can sign up for a business account? Check out the requirements for opening an account below:

### Who can open an account?

Here are the basic conditions you need to meet in order to open a bunq business account:

- [You need to have a verified personal account with bunq](https://together.bunq.com/d/38241-why-do-you-need-a-personal-account-with-your-business-account).
- You as a director cannot be a minor.
- You need to run a legitimate business in the Netherlands.
- You need to be permanently residing in the Netherlands.
- Your business should operate under one of the legal forms currently accepted by bunq. Find the full list [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/9256).
- Your company’s corporate structure and activities should comply with bunq’s requirements. More details on this below.
- Your business entity cannot have more than one account with bunq.
- If your company has multiple trade names (under the same registration on the Chamber of Commerce) - you can effortlessly open a Bank Account with the different names like we explain [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/24341-trade-names-for-your-business-bank-accounts).
- The various layers of your company should be registered as separate active legal entities with the Chamber of Commerce (Kamer van koophandel).

Once we confirm the above-mentioned conditions are met, we need to determine whether your business entity is registered with the local Chamber of Commerce or, in specific situations, you are operating on a freelance basis. Depending on that, we require different documents in order to approve your account.

Please also keep in mind that as a bank, we are legally required to store all of our user’s personal information in a secure and protected way. If there is more than one director,  we create personal accounts for each director of the business accounts. It allows us to keep your information and your company’s information safe while complying with regulations. Check out [this topic](https://together.bunq.com/d/38241) for more information.

---

## Legal forms and documents

In order to open a business account with bunq, you need to provide a legal form together with a few documents. We accept the following legal forms.

- Eenmanszaak
- Besloten Vennootschap
- Stichting 
- Vennootschap onder firma
- Maatschap
- Vereniging / Vereniging van eigenaars

**Note:** _In some cases we might require a Certificate of Beneficial owner or other document confirming the company's UBOs for every legal form listed above, apart from Eenmanszaak._

For each legal form, we require the following documents.

- Eenmanszaak
 - n/a
- Besloten Vennootschap
 - Deed of Incorporation (DOI)
 - Joint authorisation (if the directors are jointly authorised)
 - IDs of all directors and UBOs (only in some cases)
 - Record of shareholders  (only in some cases)
- Stichting
 - Deed of Incorporation (DOI)
 - Joint authorisation (if the directors are jointly authorised)
 - IDs of all directors and UBOs (only in some cases)
 - UBO form using our template (only in some cases)
- Vennootschap onder firma
 - Joint authorisation (if the directors are jointly authorised)
 - IDs of all directors and UBOs (only in some cases)
 - UBO form using our template (only in some cases)
- Maatschap
 - Joint authorisation (if the directors are jointly authorised)
 - IDs of all directors and UBOs (only in some cases)
 - UBO form using our template (only in some cases)
- Vereniging / Vereniging van eigenaars
 - Joint authorisation (if the directors are jointly authorised)
 - IDs of all directors and UBOs (only in some cases)
 - UBO form using our template (only in some cases)

Please find more information on legal documents [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/24017).

---

## Company structure

A corporate structure can consist of many layers, depending on its legal form and characteristics.
We cannot accept your company if your legal structure is too complex. We classify this as being outside of our acceptance policy if your company structure is 3+ layers. As per our acceptance policy, we should consider the following acceptance criteria:

- a company has a maximum 1 ‘layer’ in ownership and control structure between the user company (‘signing-up company’) and UBO, and all layers in NL.
- a company is directly controlled by the UBO, and all layers in the same EEA country.
- a company has a “straight-line” 4-layer structure and with all layers in NL.The second layer can consist of 1+ companies or people, but the 3rd layer can only consist of people.
- all companies in the corporate structure have to be one of our accepted legal forms.

#### The following fall outside of our risk appetite and will not be accepted:

- Foundations (Stichtingen) not managed by a natural person.
- Any legal entity managed by a Stichting.
- Companies with shares owned by companies without shares.
- STAKs (Stichting Administratiekantoor) or companies with a STAK in their ownership structure.
- Companies whose second layer includes one or more companies which are not a Besloten Vennootschap (or a foreign equivalent)
- Stichting Derdengelden

Further information can be found [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/50212).


## Company activities

In accordance with our acceptance policy, we do not support all types of businesses and activities. You can find more information on activities and check whether your business activity meets the requirements [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/9256-why-do-i-have-to-provide-business-activity-information).

**Important Note:** Always be careful with your personal data and make sure to never share it with third parties. bunq would never contact you outside of the bunq app or its official channels and ask for your credentials or any personal information (phone number, email address, security code, card number, IBAN, etc.)

**Need to report a phishing incident to bunq?** Fill out our [Phishing form](https://www.bunq.com/report) to report your incident and help us fight fraud!


### What’s phishing?

Phishing is a form of fraud where the scammer tries to impersonate reputable companies contacting you by emails, texts, social media, phone calls, etc. The purpose of this is to trick you into sharing your personal details such as passwords, account details, and card numbers in order to gain access to your funds.

## How can I avoid being phished? ‍♂️

- Never give away your login credentials or personal information
  - bunq will never ask users to provide login or personal information outside of the app. If someone pretending to be us is asking for this information, it is a scam and you shouldn't give any information.

- Check the format and spelling in messages
  - Fraudsters often go to great lengths to make their fake sources appear credible by copying the format and communication methods utilized by legitimate companies. Those fraudulent sources often contain spelling mistakes.

- Watch out for fake websites
  - The only bunq website where you have to enter your login credentials is [https://web.bunq.com/](https://web.bunq.com/.). Always make sure you’re on this website if you need to provide sensitive information of this kind. 

- Contact us via our official channels
  - If you receive an email from a source you recognize (like bunq) but it appears slightly off or suspicious, contact us to confirm that it’s authentic. This also helps us to identify new scams.

- Be careful with your posts on social media
  - When posting on social media, be careful with your personal information like your date of birth, vacation plans, address, phone number etc. This information can be used by criminals in an attempt to scam you.

- Check the URLs of the links you click on
  - It’s always better to check and verify the link (especially in hyperlinked texts) that it indeed includes the legitimate domain name of the website you’re about to access. If in doubt, spend an extra 10 seconds to manually go to the desired page via the official website.

## How can I recognize a Phishing attempt?

Phishing can take a lot of different forms. Fraudsters can email you, send you a text message (SMS or other means) and even call you pretending to be bunq in order to trick you into giving away personal details that will help them gain access to our account. They will insinuate a situation of urgency such as an unrecognized device detected on your account, change of personal details information, something wrong is going on with your account and you need to verify it, etc. A link ‘for your convenience’ is provided and the moment you follow it and input any personal details (username, password, IBAN, etc.), they already got what they needed - THE ACCESS. You may also receive an SMS, an email or a phone call from a company telling you that you need to pay a certain ‘fee’ but require your credentials in order to proceed.

Our domain name is bunq.com. Every link which is different from https://www.bunq.com/ or https://together.bunq.com/ claiming to be a source of information is fraudulent. If you don’t see it in the URL address of the webpage, this means that link is not managed by bunq. Any variations such as bunq.xxx.com, a.id/abcd-bunq or abcd.buzz/bunq are all fake. If you come across such links, please report them [here](https://www.bunq.com/report) using our Phishing report form. 

Here are examples of what a fake email messages,  SMS or website look like:






  




**Important:** Fraudsters can misuse online tools to fake our name in the sender field of their SMS/text, therefore your smartphone may automatically insert fraudulent messages in the same thread as legitimate messages you’ve previously received from us.

Don't block our number, even if you've received the phishing SMS from there. This way we won't be able to actually send you messages which will help you to finish your verification or do other matters through the app

## What will happen after you submit the report?

Our dedicated team will be made aware of your report and will take immediate actions to take these websites and links down. Once a hacked account is reported, we'll act quickly to help you get back into your account. However, this only applies to cases of hacked accounts, not phishing websites.  We’ve already reported the scams to our relevant teams and the operational teams of the most widely used web browsers. They’re ensuring that all phishing websites are taken down and any funds lost by victims are returned.

What happens with my invested funds?

Hey bunqers  

Based on your risk appetite, Birdee invests your money into one of their different portfolios

When you add money to your Easy Investments account, they're transferred out of your bunq account to be invested in assets via Birdee. However, they will still be visible in the app so you can keep track of your investments 

When you withdraw funds from your Easy Investments account, the opposite happens. Your investments are sold in the marketplace, and the return is transferred back into your bunq account. For this reason, deposits and withdrawals aren't immediate and take some time to be fully processed.

### Deposit and withdrawal 

- Your first deposit must be of €50.00 or more. Afterwards, you can deposit anything up from €10.00.
- If you withdraw from the Easy Investments account and the remaining balance  is less than €50.00, you'll have to withdraw all funds. In other words, you must have at least €50.00 in the account, unless you take out all the funds.
- When you withdraw funds, your investments are sold in the marketplace. There may be slight fluctuations in the value of your assets when they're actually sold, meaning the final amount that's returned can be slightly lower than the amount you see when you withdraw all.
- If you withdraw, it’ll take a few days for the money to arrive due to processing time.

## How long do investment deposits take to be processed?
Your first investment deposit may take up to **4 business days** to complete, but following deposits will take less time to process. If you've made a deposit in the last 2 business days, you'll see Deposit in progress in your app.

## How do I adjust my deposit?

You invest a certain amount on a monthly basis directly from one of your Bank Accounts to the investments account. On a monthly basis you get a scheduled payment, this is the action through which you invest in your investments account. You can alter this amount by following the steps below:
1. Go to Home
2. Select the Bank Account via which you invest
3. Go to Settings, then **Scheduled payments**
4. Find the payment scheduled for your investment account 
5. Tap the little pencil ✏️  on the top to edit the amount

 Both accountant agencies and Directors of the company. If the request is submitted by the accountant, you’ll be asked for confirmation that the owner of the business is aware of the charge of €100.00.

How do I request a standard bank statement?

Hey bunqers  

Time for the Fiscal Year-End? No worries, we’ve got you covered! 

### What is a standard bank statement?

A standard bank statement is a document that provides an overview of your accounts and credit facilities with your bank. This confirms who is authorized to act on behalf of the company. We use the format for standard bank statements of Nederlandse Beroepsorganisatie van Accountants (NBA). 

### How do I request a standard bank statement? 

Simply reach out to our [Support team](https://www.bunq.com/link/support) and request a standard bank statement by providing them with the following  info:

- Name of accounting firm and address
- Name of accountant and e-mail address
- Name and email address of the person we should send a copy to
- Preferred language (Dutch or English)
- In the cases where the accountant is requesting the standard bank statement, please confirm that the company owner is aware of our fee (listed below)

## Costs

The export of a standard bank statement costs €120. Fore more information, please check out our pricing sheet [here](https://www.bunq.com/en/pricing-sheet) 

## When can I receive it?

After the request is submitted we will aim to send the standard bank statement to you and your accountant in less than 10 working days. If the bank statement isn’t sent to you by this deadline, make sure to contact us and let us know so that we can assist you further.
__________

## FAQs

**Q. Can I have the balance of the Bank Account reflected on the bank statement?**
A: Account balance information information is not listed on standard bank statements. If you wish to have a document showing your Bank Account's balance, it is best to export an annual overview report through the app. You can do so by following the steps [here](https://together.bunq.com/d/2523) 

**Q: My account has been created this year and the fiscal year is not over yet. Can I still receive a bank statement or do I have to wait for the fiscal year to be over?**
    A: There is no need to wait!  However, you should keep in mind that the standard bank statement will _not include the complete fiscal year_. Furthermore, if another statement is requested at the end of the year, you will be charged again. Our advice (unless the statement is vital to be obtained ASAP) is to wait until the end of the fiscal year to have a complete overview 

**Q: I need a standard bank statement, but my account is closed / has insufficient balance. What do I do?**
A: You can transfer the fee of €120 using the bunq.me link https://bunq.me/statement with a reference: Standard Bank statement for {Company X}. and request the standard bank statement per the above procedure.
